Therefore, she requested a loan to buy raw materials so that she can knit more embroidered dresses to sell and increase her income. 

Yasmeen is the mother of three daughters and a son. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through large sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of the revenue to provide a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for embroidery work.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en: Mercedita is 25 years old, female and single, living in Cagayan Province. She raises hogs to sell for a living. She gets an income of about 2,000 PHP for each hog disposed. She is now asking a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy feed and vaccines for the maintenance and growth of her livestock business. This will greatly help her nurture her chosen business for the future. She hopes to continue to earn a good income in hog-raising and somehow sustain financial stability someday.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for the maintenance and growth of her livestock business.

loans.name: Henrry Salomon

texts.es: Henrry, tiene 32 años de edad, esta soltero, vive con su familia en el municipio de Omoa, Cortes. Anteriormente vivió fuera del país y hace cinco años decidió por establecer su propio negocio de venta de comidas. vende almuerzos, cenas y refrescos. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 21,000 Lempiras para invertir en su negocio, va comprar materia prima como arroz, aceite, vegetales, carnes, condimentos, refrescos, etc., para la elaboración de comidas y vender. El tiene como un sueño de llegar a tener un local propio para establecer bien el negocio y vender solo comida Bufet.
texts.en:
Henrry is 32 years old, single, and lives with his family in the town of Omoa, Cortes.  He previously lived abroad, but five years ago he decided to establish his own food business.  Henrry sells lunches, dinners, and soft drinks.  

He is requesting a loan in the amount of 21,000 HNL so that he can invest in his business.  Henrry will buy supplies such as rice, oil, vegetables, meats, condiments, soft drinks, and other items for preparing the dishes he will sell.  His dream is to have his own location where his business can be well-established and he can sell only buffet food.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, vegetables, meats, condiments, soft drinks, and other supplies.

loans.name: Gennelyn

texts.en:
Gennelyn is 34 years old, married, and has two children. Her spouse is a tricycle driver and a farmer, too. Together, they help each other in planting and harvesting rice on 1.2 hectares of land that they cultivate. They have been in farming for over five years now, earning an average of PHP 10,000 each harvest season (twice a year). 

Gennelyn's income is invested in paying the school fees of her children and also serves as revolving capital for their farming business. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy pesticides and insecticides for their farming maintenance. 

In the future, Gennelyn and her spouse hope to become successful in growing rice and to keep providing for their children's education.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and insecticides for their farming maintenance.

loans.name: Karen Claire

texts.en: Karen Claire is 20 years old, married and lives in Alcala. To make a living, she runs a store and raises hogs for income. She has been earning about 5,000 PHP as net income monthly in her businesses. She hopes to keep nourishing her hogs to be able to offer them at a higher cost and have her general store business succeed more. Thus, she is asking for a loan that will serve as additional business capital in both her store and hog-raising businesses: to buy groceries for her store and feed and medicines for hogs.

loans.use: to buy groceries, feed and medicine for hogs.

loans.name: Narlie

texts.en:
Narlie's previous loan was very helpful for her business and she is very thankful. It also helped in the education of her child, who is now in college. Narlie's income from the business is helping her with her family's everyday expenses, for which she and her husband are working to provide.

She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of the tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Narlie hopes to have an additional tricycle and dreams that her child will finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Fatehy

texts.en:
Fatehy, 26 years old, is a married man but he doesn`t have any children. He and his wife live together in Taiz, Yemen. He is a tailor who works hard to allow him to support his family; so he has sole responsibility for them now. 

Fatehy has a small room which he inherited from his father in order to run his business. He trained his wife and mother to help him in working in the same field. He tells us that he is very happy with the business now. 

He wants to expand by adding a wider range of fabrics, so he is applying for a youth loan of 200,000 YER to buy more sewing machines to expand his business so that he can cover a lot of demand for these products in the market. 

He hopes to open a sewing store to increase his profit and improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy more sewing machines to expand his business.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 39-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four daughters and a son.
 
Farzana requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband. Her husband is a shoe-maker by profession. He had been making shoes in a small firm for many years, and earning reasonable income. 

Now he started his own shop for making shoes. He will take contracts for making shoes. He wants to buy tools and raw materials for making shoes, but does not have amount left to buy the remaining goods.
 
Therefore, Farzana requested a loan for her husband so he can buy all the remaining raw materials for the newly openned shop.

Farzana is very thankful to Kiva and it's field partner ,BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making shoes.

loans.name: Maria Xiomara

texts.es:
María Xiomara tiene 31 años de edad es madres de 1 solo hijo el cual tiene un año de edad y en compañía de su esposo se dedican a la agricultura especialmente a lo que es la siembra y cultivo de café. Fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron desde muy pequeña esta actividad ya que en su familia es un medio de ingreso económico para cubrir las diferentes necesidades como ser: vestimenta, alimentación, medicinas con muchas restricciones, entre otros. El terreno que ella en compañía de su esposo cultiva es propio ya que sus padres le heredaron un pedazo de tierra para que ella pudiese trabajar y pudiese tener un ingreso. Ella en la actualidad quiere proteger y dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos para evitar que sean infectados por la roya o por la broca que es un bicho dañino y destructor.

María Xiomara ha solicitado aun financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para comprar insumos como: urea, abono, herbicidas, fertilizantes entre otros para proteger su cosecha de café. Sus planes para el futuro es poder expandir sus cultivos por medio de la compra de tierra para poder cultivar más café y generar más ingresos para su familia y para su hogar. Ella también sueña con darle a su hijo la mejor educación, verlo crecer y graduado universitaria mente.
texts.en:
Maria is 31 years old and mother to a one year old son. Together with her husband she works in agriculture, particularly in the planting and cultivation of coffee. It was her parents who taught this activity to her at a young age because in her family it is a means of income, covering different needs such as: clothing, food, medicines with many restrictions, among others. The land that she - together with her husband - cultivates is her own, as she inherited part of it from her parents so that she would be able to work and could have an income. She currently wants to protect and maintain their crops in order to avoid being infected by fungi or by 'la broca' (a type of pest which affects coffee plants) which is a harmful and destructive insect.

Maria has requested funding through the COMIXMUL cooperative in order to buy supplies such as urea, manure, herbicides, fertilizers etc, to protect their coffee harvest. Her plans for the future are to be able to expand her crops by purchasing more land in order to grow more coffee and generate more income for her family and home. She also dreams of giving her son the best education, to see him grow and graduate from university.

loans.use: to buy manure, urea, herbicides and others to protect and maintain her coffee crops

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is applying for a loan of USD 1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin (TRM). She is 30 years old. 

She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store, such as bags for school children, bags for adults, children's toys, slippers, books, and pencils. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for larger loan in the future. 

Maria is living in a town, nearby the school. Her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy, including students.

loans.use: To buy bags for school children, bags for adults, children's toys, slippers, books, and pencils.

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus is 32 years old and married with two children.

Venus works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,500 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries for resale.

Venus has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years, and also earns income from raising pigs.

Venus aspires to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for resale.

loans.name: Rosantina

texts.en:
Rosantina is 26 years old and married with two children. She is applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She opened her secondhand clothing business in 2000, with her own working capital of $50. She earns a good income from her business.

Rosantina will use her loan to buy inventory to keep in her store, such as  trousers, shorts and shirts. She is a very hard working woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 13 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future. And she is happy with this loan because it could improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shorts and shirts.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en: Trinidad is 55 years old and happily living with her husband in their village of Raniag. She has four children, all of whom are married. Her husband serves as a negotiator in the buying and selling of cars and animals. Trinidad sells grocery items in her village as her business. She is new in the business, but her determination to develop and succeed in it has led her to be wise in managing the business and encourages her to seek additional capital of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase goods for resale, such as bread, cold drinks, seasonings, sugar, coffee, and more.

loans.use: to purchase goods for resale, such as bread, cold drinks, seasonings, sugar, coffee, and more.

loans.name: Flordelino

texts.en:
Flordelino is a 54-year-old farmer, and gets an income by planting and harvesting rice to sell. He owns .75 hectare of rice field. He is married to Teofila, and they have five children who attend school. 

He would like to improve his crop production but has insufficient funds, so he is now asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy fertilizers and pay for labor cost used in farming. This will help him nourish his crops and enable him to harvest better yield. 

He will be very happy to see all his children become professionals someday with his hard work in managing his farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labor cost used in farming.

loans.name: Seang

texts.en:
Seang, aged 39, is originally from Kampong Thom province. She is married and has four children. All of them are attending to school. 

Her spouse helps her maintain their farm in Rattanakiri province. She plants and harvests rice to sell. She has been in her farming business for almost 13 years and earns about KHR 40,000 per day. Seang would like to improve her farming business and increase her yields, from which she can satisfy her living needs. 

Due to insufficient funds, she has borrowed a loan of KHR 4,000,000 to buy a piece of farmland for farming activities. With the loan support, she hopes to build a strong business and expects to have an abundant harvest in this coming season.

loans.use: to buy a piece of farmland for farming activities.

loans.name: Anyi Yulied

texts.es: Anyi con 22 años de edad, es madre de un hijo de 4 años y vive en unión libre con su compañero sentimental. Se dedica a trabajar los fines de semana en un estadero, vendiendo comidas rápidas y alterna su empleo con la venta de mercancía de manera independiente, con el ánimo de complementar sus ingresos. Es una joven activa emprendedora y pujante, lucha incansablemente para darle lo mejor a su pequeño hijo, quien es su principal motivación para seguir trabajando cada día. Solicita el ciclo del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (camisas, jeans, zapatos, correas, entre otros), así podrá aprovechar los descuentos que obtiene por comprar de contado, lo que le permitirá aumentar el margen de utilidad que le deja cada venta, adicionalmente tendrá más variedad de artículos disponibles para ofrecer a sus clientes y así satisfacer los diversos gustos. De esta manera, Anyi desea continuar trabajando para lograr cumplir el sueño de abrir una tienda de ropa de marca, que sea reconocido y le permita tener una estabilidad económica para dar a su hijo una buena educación y aportar positivamente en las finanzas del hogar.
texts.en:
Anyi is 22 years old and the mother of a four-year-old son.  She and her sweetheart are in a common-law relationship.  Anyi works on the weekends at a tavern where she sells fast food, but she also divides her time between this job and selling merchandise on her own so that she can supplement her income.  She is an active, enterprising, and vibrant young woman who strives tirelessly to provide the best for her young son since he is the main reason why she continues to work each day.    

Anyi is requesting a line of credit so that she can invest in the purchase of merchandise in bulk (shirts, jeans, shoes, belts, and other items).  This will enable her to take advantage of discounts for purchasing with cash.  As a result, she will be able to increase her profit margin with each sale.  In addition, Anyi will have a wider variety of available merchandise to offer to her customers, which will satisfy their diverse tastes.  Anyi wants to continue working in this manner so that she can fulfill her dream of opening a clothing store where she can offer brand-name merchandise.  She wants to become well-known so that she can have financial stability, which will allow her to provide a good education for her son and have a positive contribution to the household finances.

loans.use: to buy shirts, jeans, shoes, belts, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Tith

texts.en:
Tith, age 32, is a farmer living in Baray district of Kampong Thom province. She grows seasonal crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice to sell, whereas her husband is in the business of fishing. They have been blessed with two children who attend school. 

Tith would like to improve her family-owned businesses and increase their income to satisfy the needs of her family. Due to the lack of capital, she has applied for a loan of 500,000 KHR to buy fishing materials, such as fishing nets, hooks, lines and other traps. This will enable her husband to ensure the collection of fish for sale. Someday, with good profits from the businesses, Tith will attain a successful life for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials, such as fishing nets, hooks, lines and other traps.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fabric, thread, and a sewing machine

loans.name: Mariela De Jesús

texts.es: Mariela, con 63 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos y cabeza de hogar desde que su esposo falleció. Hace aproximadamente 8 años inició su negocio, una fábrica de arepas que comenzó por la crisis económica que sufrió su familia luego del fallecimiento de su esposo. Poco a poco ha salido adelante pues nunca estudió y todo lo que hoy en día sabe ha sido obtenido por el método de prueba/error, ella trabaja de Lunes a Domingo de 5:00 am a 4:00 pm, con el fin de aprovechar el tiempo al máximo para sacar toda la producción que sus clientes le encargan. Solicita el crédito como apoyo para ampliar su negocio para lo que requiere adecuar y ampliar la bodega, ampliar los hornos, comprar un molino eléctrico y materia prima (maíz) e insumos para empaque, de esta forma podrá mejorar las condiciones de trabajo y podrá cumplir con las entregas de los pedidos de manera oportuna, lo que le dará la oportunidad de ampliar su mercado y aumentar sus ventas y sus ingresos. Mariela sueña con hacer crecer su negocio y convertirlo en una gran empresa productora y distribuidora de arepas que le genere mayor rentabilidad para tener la posibilidad de apoyar a sus hijos económicamente y disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida y progreso.
texts.en: Mariela is 63 years old, mother to 5 children and the head of the household since the death of her husband. Approximately 8 years ago she set up her own business, a corn cake factory which began as a result of the economic crisis suffered by her family after the death of her husband. Gradually it has gone from strength to strength, yet she never studied and everything that she knows today is a result of trial and error. She worked Monday to Sunday from 5 am to 4 pm, so that she could take advantage of the time to meet the orders of all her clients. She is requesting this loan as help in order to expand her business. She plans to adapt and expand the storeroom, expand the ovens, purchase an electric mill and purchase raw material (corn) and supplies for packaging. As a result of these, she will be able to improve working conditions and will be able to meet order deliveries in a timely manner, which will give her the opportunity to expand her market and increase her sales and income. Mariela dreams of growing her business and turning it into a large manufacturer and distributor of corn cakes which generates higher returns, giving her the possibility of supporting her children financially and enjoying a better quality of life.

loans.use: to adapt and expand the storeroom, expand the ovens, purchase an electric mill and raw material (corn) and supplies for packaging

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a former Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW). She has worked and earned there for 11 years to give her children a bright future. After her two eldest children finished their schooling and had their jobs, she then returned back to the Philippines and started her eatery business as a source of income. She gets allowances for her two younger children from her income in the business then. 
 
Marivic wishes to request a PHP 20,000 loan that she will use to purchases various vegetables, rice and meat to prepare and cook for meals she daily offers in her food business. This would be a great opportunity to develop her business income more. 

She hopes that her requested loan will be provided by the generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchases various vegetables, rice and meat to prepare and cook for meals she daily offers in her food business.

loans.name: Emilly

texts.en:
Emilly is 28-year-old tailor. She is married to Jackson, an employee in an insurance company, and, together, they are blessed with one child. Emilly has been a tailor for the past five years, with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses as upkeep for her family. 

Emilly is applying for her second loan with Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET), after successfully repaying the previous loans. She will use the loan to buy a new sewing machine and sewing materials. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, Emilly will improve the standards of her business and that of her family. Emilly hopes and dreams that she will buy a vehicle for transport purposes.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and sewing materials.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 43 years old, is married and has four children aged 19, 17, 14 and 11 years. He runs a retail shop in Kangundo town and has been in the business for 15 years. 

He will be using the loan to buy more stock of sugar, salt, rice and flour. He will use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to buy more stock and will also start selling cereals in his shop.

This is his sixth loan term and he paid all his previous loans successfully. In the future, Patrick hopes to educate his children to tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Isidora

texts.en:
This is Isidora. She previously accessed an 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories, and pay for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help for her children's education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Isidora hopes to have an additional tricycle unit and dreams that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her Tricycle unit.

loans.name: Adila Del Carmen

texts.es: Adila, es una mujer de 49 años de edad que se dedica a atender su negocio, una heladería que inició hace aproximadamente 3 meses, con el interés de generar los recursos económicos por su propia cuenta; trabaja de lunes a domingo de 2:00 a 10:00 pm y cuenta con el apoyo de una empleada. Su negocio ha tendido buenos resultados pues ha sido bien acogida en el sector donde se encuentra ubicado. Actualmente solicita el crédito para comprar un televisor para el local, insumos al por mayor (helados, salsas dulces, frutas) y para realizar publicidad y sacar las cartas de menú, de esta forma podrá prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y tendrá la capacidad para aumentar las ventas y los ingresos económicos, con los que solventa las necesidades básicas de su hogar. Adila sueña con fortalecer y acreditar bien su negocio para que sea más próspero y rentable, que le genere una estabilidad económica favorable para que en un futuro pueda disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Adila is a woman of 49 who runs her business, an ice cream shop, that she started approximately three months ago in the interest of generating income on her own account. She works from Monday to Sunday, from 2:00pm to 10:00pm, and has the help of an employee. 

Her business has had good results, as it has been well received in the area where it is located. Currently she is requesting the loan so that she can buy a television for the shop, supplies at wholesale (ice creams, sweet sauces and fruits), do advertising and get menus done. This way she will be able to provide better service to her customers, and have the ability to increase sales and income to cover her household's basic needs. 

Adila dreams of building a strong business with a good reputation so that it is more prosperous and profitable. This is so that it will generate good financial stability for her so that someday she can enjoy a better quality of life and well-being.

loans.use: To buy a television for the shop, supplies at wholesale (ice creams, sweet sauces, fruits), do advertising and get menus done.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela tiene 40 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a prestar servicios de belleza, realizando cortes, cepillados, químicos, manicure y pedicure, trabaja a domicilio o desde su casa. Aprendió de esta actividad, gracias a sus familiaes que se han desempeñando en esta área durante mucho tiempo, pero ella poco a poco a ido perfeccionando sus conocimientos y su técnica, pues ha realizado diferentes cursos de belleza. Actualmente solicita el crédito como apoyo para comprar muebles de peluquería, silla, espejo, silla de pedicure y una plancha para el cabello, de esta manera podrá adecuar bien su negocio y prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo que se verá reflejado en el incremento de las ventas y de los ingresos personales. Adela sueña con ampliar su negocio, adquirir un local donde pueda generar oportunidades de empleo y así mejorar notablemente su economía y la calidad de vida que merece disfrutar al lado de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Adela is 40 years old, has two children, and lives with her common-law husband. For the last four years she has offered services such as hair cuts, chemical treatments, manicures and pedicures. She works out of her home. Adela learned about beauty treatments from family members who have worked in this area for many years. Gradually she has perfected her knowledge and techniques through various beauty courses.

Now Adela is seeking a loan to buy furniture for her hairdressing salon such as a chair, mirror, pedicure chair, and a curling iron. Then she will be able to equip her salon well and offer her customers a better service. This will result in increased business and income.

Adela’s dream is to expand her business and acquire premises so that she can offer employment to other people. She hopes to greatly improve her financial situation and standard of living for both herself and her children.

loans.use: buy furniture for her hairdressing salon such as a chair, mirror, pedicure chair, and a curling iron

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly is 53 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines; she has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pig fattening. 

Jelly has requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. Jelly aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lurdes

texts.en:
Lurdes lives in a town with her family. She opened her kiosk in 2009 through her own work. Lurdes generates a good income from selling.

A $1,000 loan is offered to Lurdes to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy stock for her store, like statues, scissors, hair ties, shoes, and handbags. She has been dreaming of running a big business after years of involving herself in business.

loans.use: To buy stock for her store

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This is Evelyn. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Evelyn dreams that her business will grow bigger and her children will all finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: As a married mother of three children, Maricel works hard to support her family. She has a furniture making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock.  Maricel is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for her furniture making business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her furniture making business.

loans.name: Nonita

texts.en: Nonita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a beauty parlor business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to buy cosmetics supplies for her beauty parlor. She has been in this business for five years, and earns additional income from a food market. Nonita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics supplies for her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a 26-year-old woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married, with a five year old daughter. Her husband is a fisherman.

She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various items ranging from cooking oil, sugar, noodles, canned goods, condiments and gasoline. Her business started two months ago. She is asking for a loan to buy a sack of rice and gasoline for her retail business to help augment the income of their household.

In the future, she hopes to expand her small business and increase business profitability for her children’s education, and to improve their livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy  a sack of rice and gasoline

loans.name: Chour

texts.en:
Chour is a resident living in Ponhea Lueu district, Kandal province. She is 26 years old, married and a mother of two children. She is a homemaker who is responsible for taking care of the family, educating her children at home and serving them nutritional foods. Her husband works as a paid laborer at a construction site and this serves as the family's major source of income. 

Chour wanted to create another business opportunity to generate additional income for household, but she has insufficient funds to make it possible. That’s why she has applied for a loan of KHR 1,400,000 to buy a fishing boat and other materials needed for fishing activities. With her hard work and the help of this loan, she believes that someday she will attain success and provide a better life for her children.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat and other materials needed for fishing activities.

loans.name: Jacinta Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Señora Jacinta del Socorro, es docente de uno de los colegios de la ciudad de León, desde hace veinticinco años. Sale de su casa a las 12:30 pm e inicia sus labores desde 01:00 pm hasta las 05:45 pm este  horario de lunes a viernes y los días domingos de 07:00 am a 03:00 pm, es madre soltera de tres hijos. Realiza estas labores para el sustento de su familia.
  
Doña Jacinta del Socorro, el crédito  que solicito  a Ceprodel fue utilizado para gastos médicos y compra de medicinas, lo que le permitirá recuperar su salud y así continuar con sus labores diario.
texts.en:
Jacinta del Socorro has been a teacher at one of the schools in the city of León for 25 years.  Monday through Friday she leaves home at 12:30 p.m. and works from 1 until 5:45; on Sunday she works from 7 a.m. until 3 p.m.  She's the single mother of three children.  She does this job to support her family.

Jacinta del Socorro used the loan from CEPRODEL for medical expenses and to buy medicine so she can recover her health and continue her daily work.

loans.use: to pay for medical expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 100 hens and 100 chicks and  concentrate for the animals, as well as to pay off two 2 loans she has with other entities.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es: Luis es un hombre de 65 años de edad, casado y padre de 3 hijos. Nació en el campo, donde aprendió las tareas agropecuarias, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre y sus hermanos. Trabajó durante muchos años en una empresa, pero en el momento de su jubilación él decidió comenzar la actividad de la ganadería, por lo que adquirió ganado lechero y de levante, para así complementar los ingresos para su familia. Durante el desarrollo de su labor ha sobrepasado distintas adversidades por el alto costo del concentrado y los abonos para el pasto, además de los bajos precios de venta de la leche, sin embargo ha sabido salir adelante. Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de más ganado de levante y cancelar el saldo de un crédito que tiene vigente, esto le permitirá aumentar su capacidad de producción y por ende sus ventas e ingresos. Luis sueña con fortalecer su negocio y hacerlo crecer para que le permita generar mayores ingresos y poder dar una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar a las personas que ama.
texts.en: Luis is a 65 year old man. He is married and the father of 3 children. He was born in the country, where he learned the tasks of farming and livestock raising, thanks to the teachings of his father and siblings. He worked for many years in a business, but at the time of his retirement he decided to to begin the activity of cattle raising. To that he acquired dairy cattle and breeding cattle to add to the family's income. While he has done his work he has overcome different adversities due to the high cost of concentrate and fertilizer for the pasture and the low prices of milk. Nonetheless, he has gotten ahead. Right now, he is asking for the loan in order to invest in buying more breeding cattle and to pay off a previous loan that he has. This will allow him to increase his production capacity and therefore his sales and income. Luis dreams of fortifying his business and making it grow to allow it to generate more income and be able to give a better quality of life and well being to the people whom he loves.

loans.use: to buy more breeding cattle and pay off the balance of a loan he has.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en: Danilo's main source of income comes from his gardening business. He resides in Tonggo, Jimenez, along with his family and he has been gardening for more than three years.  Danilo joined GDMPC in 2012 and his previous loan that he used to buy farm inputs was successfully repaid. Danilo is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure and more variety of seeds. He plans to use the profit generated from his garden to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Rexes

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Rexes works hard to support her family.

She has a food market business in the Philippines and earns additional income from rice retailing. Rexes is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of frozen foods and dressed chicken to sell in her food stall.

Rexes has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen foods and dressed chicken to sell

loans.name: Romela

texts.en:
Romela is 42 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Romela has a fishing business in the Philippines. Romela requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Romela has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Romela would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Amia

texts.en:
This is Amia. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Amia dreams of continual success in business and hopes that her children will have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Rosiel

texts.en: Rosiel is 44 years old, and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a business selling clothing in the Philippines. Rosiel has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like blouses, bags, slippers and other clothing. She has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like blouses, bags, slippers and other clothing.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira is from Yerevan where she lives with her husband and daughter. Naira's daughter Anush is a student. She studies at Yerevan State University of Architecture and Construction. She specializes in the department of design. She studies very hard and dreams of becoming a high quality designer. 
Naira and her husband work hard to sustain their life and cover Anush's education costs. Naira works at a local music school as a piano teacher, and her husband works at the local municipality hall. Their income is enough for covering their basic costs, but for Anush's education they have no money left  So Naira is asking for a loan to cover her daughter's university tuition. The loan is very important for the whole family and they hope for the lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 55-years-old and the mother of five sons.

Her husband is a milk seller by profession and he sells milk and yogurt at a shop with the help of two sons. He sells yogurt two times in a day but milk three times in day.

He is well known in his hometown due to the purity and freshness of his milk and this is the reason there is a lot of rush always present at the shop. He has been selling milk for many years. Now his sales have increased and he wants to offer more quantity of milk.  He has savings but it is for his son’s marriage ceremony.

Therefore, Nasreen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband could buy more milk to sell. 

Nasreen says thank you to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy milk to sell and produce yogurt.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a young, ambitious Yemeni man. He runs a new enterprise of Arabic men’s fabrics. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen.

He is 26 years old, determined and highly dedicated to his business. He started as a seller of clothes in a retail shop. Ali knows how to attract people to buy his goods due to having more experience in his last career.  He is able to participate in meeting the financial needs of his family. 

He would like to stock his business more so that he can increase his profit. So, he applied for a youth loan of 200,000 YER to buy Arabic fabrics. 

He would like to expand his business and attract more clients in order to get married and improve his life.

loans.use: to buy Arabic fabrics to stock his business.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline works hard to support her family. She is unmarried and has a vegetable selling stall in the Philippines.

Angeline has requested a PHP 5000 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy more stock of vegetables to sell at her food stall.

She has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Angeline would like to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables to sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
This is Rebecca. She previously accessed an 10,000 PHP loan that she used for the operation expenses for her funeral parlor. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP that will be used for the operation expenses for her funeral parlor. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rebecca hopes that her business will just keep on growing. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the operation expenses for her funeral parlor.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice lives in the Kericho area, which lies in the tea growing region of Kenya. She has three children and has been doing this work for five years. Her primary income sources are milk and tea.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Farming." Her biggest challenge is "Lack of capital."  Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Lelgina."

Beatrice was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "payment is made in equal installments."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "Cheap interest."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Beatrice replied "Increased income."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Beatrice owns the following: "cow, poultry, motorcycle| but does not own "pig, pump, bicycle, automobile". Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household "mosquito net, TV" but does not have "electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, DVD".

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 29 years old and from Nakuru.  He is not married but he supports his parents financially.  He is a hotelier, a business he has been running for the past year.  Paul applied for his first loan of KES 15,000 from Kadet Ltd.  He he hopes to use it to pay the institution where he has enrolled to learn skills on hotel management.  With the remaining amount he plans to buy potatoes, cooking fat, and sugar.  These items are necessary for his hotel customers.  

Paul’s current monthly income is KES 10,000.  He plans to use the profits from his expanding business in order to start another business.  He hopes to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to enroll in training for hotel management and to buy items for his hotel customers.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is a farmer residing in Panaon, Misamis Occidental. His children are all married and he is now earning for the family with his backyard garden of vegetables to sell while his wife is selling snacks in their community to earn a living. He always finds ways to earn in order to gain an income to augment their living. 

He plans to expand and improve his garden so he borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP in order to buy seedlings and fertilizer such as manure. He is hopeful to harvest more in return for his investment.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
Remy is a 42-year-old married woman with four children who are in school.  She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Remy has a business selling bananas in the Philippines.  Remy requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more bananas to sell to customers.

Remy has been in this business for two years.  In the future, Remy would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy bananas.

loans.name: Bienvinida

texts.en:
This is Bienvinida.  Her previous loan was a big help in her business.  She was able to buy all of the necessary spare parts for her jeepney.  The loan also helped with their everyday expenses at home.  She and her husband are both working to provide for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and to pay for the maintenance of their jeepney unit.  The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Bienvinida hopes to be successful in her business and to help others.  She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.  This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*Curiously, jeepneys have purely American origins.  They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese government.  Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney.  The modifications made it open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy enough for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain.  Now, jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance for their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is married and has four children. She resides in Macabayao in Jimenez Misamis Occidental with her family. 

To make a living, she helps her husband manage and operate their motor transportation and rental business. Her husband is a driver and transports passengers and baggage. In order to maintain good service, Marcelina wants to buy spare parts and accessories for motorcycle repair and maintenance.

Marcelina joined GDMPC microcredit in 2012 and borrowed a loan that year. In the future, she wants to have a new line of motorcycles for her business and to earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories for motorcycle repair and maintenance

loans.name: Miriam Rocío

texts.es: Miriam es madre de 3 hijos y vive en unión libre con su compañero sentimental. Aprendió el oficio de la confección gracias a unos cursos que realizó con el apoyo de una fundación. A sus 39 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar como empleada doméstica y a vender mercancía por catálogo, pero con el ánimo de mejorar sus ingresos y de explotar todo su potencial y los conocimientos obtenidos en sus cursos, desea iniciar su propio taller de confección, para lo cual solicita el apoyo del crédito; con el dinero comprará los activos fijos (máquina plana, recubridora, fileteadora) e insumos (telas, hilos, elásticos, botones), así dará inicio a su proyecto productivo con el que espera generar los recursos suficientes para continuar llevando el sustento a su hogar. Miriam sueña con fortalecer y hacer crecer su taller poco a poco, para que en un futuro pueda tener una marca propia reconocida en el mercado, que le ayude a mejorar las condiciones de vida y el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Miriam is a mother of three children and she lives in a common-law marriage with her partner.  She learned the craft of sewing thanks to come courses that she took with help from a foundation. At 39 years old, she makes a living working as a housemaid and selling merchandise through a catalog.  But with the courage to improve her income and to take advantage of her potential and the knowledge that she obtained in the courses, she wishes to start her own sewing workshop.  This is why she asks for the support of a loan.  

With the money she will buy fixed assets like an industrial sewing machine, a coverstitch machine, and an overlock machine; and supplies like fabric, thread, elastic, and buttons.  This way she will begin her profitable project with the hope of generating enough resources to continue supporting the household.  Miriam dreams of strengthening and making her workshop grow little by little, so that in the future she can have a brand of her own that is known throughout the market, which would help to improve the living conditions and well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets like an industrial sewing machine, a coverstitch machine, an overlock machine; and supplies like fabric, thread, elastic, and buttons.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Bernardo is a 41 year old man from the town of Talibon, Bohol. He is married and has a six year old daughter.

He runs a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells various items such as biscuits,candies,soy sauce, noodles,eggs, and soap. He started his business more than 10 years ago. He is asking for a loan to buy a case of soft drinks and a sack of rice to help augment the income of his household and also cater to the needs of his customers.

In the future, He hopes to expand his small business and increase business profitability for his child's education.

loans.use: to buy a case of soft drinks and a sack of rice for his business

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 27 years old, married to Magret, and supports a family of three people. John has been in this business for the last two years with the monthly income of 30,000 KES.  This loan from KADET LTD of 30,000 KES will be used to purchase phone accessories to boost his business. John will use the anticipated profit to purchase more stock and buy spare parts for his motorbike. His hopes and dreams are to have a successful life.

loans.use: to purchase phone accessories to boost his business

loans.name: Buena

texts.en:
This is Buena. She previously accessed an 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts, accessories, and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Buena hopes that her business will last longer. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and for maintenance of her Tricycle unit.

loans.name: Billy Yones

texts.es: Billy, a sus 28 años de edad, es casado y padre de un hijo de 6 años. Durante varios años trabajó como empleado en una piñatería, pero, desde hace 2 meses decidió independizarse y montar su propio negocio, allí ofrece todo tipo de juguetería y artículos para bebés y niños, trabaja todos los días y está generando empleo. El cliente es un hombre activo, pujante y tiene un espíritu emprendedor que lo ha llevado a conseguir sus objetivos. Actualmente solicita el crédito con el ánimo de invertirlo en mercancía al por mayor (juguetes y artículos para bebés y niños), de esta manera tendrá más variedad de productos disponibles para la venta con lo que podrá satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes. Billy sueña con tener un local propio en el que pueda desarrollar su actividad y así generar mejores ingresos que le permitan sacar adelante a su familia, ofreciéndoles mejores condiciones de vida y una excelente educación a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Billy is 28 years old, married and the father of a six-year-old son. For several years he worked as an employee in a store that sold piñatas, but two months ago decided to go out on his own and set up his own business. There he offers all kinds of toys, as well as items for babies and children. He works every day and is generating employment. The client is an energetic, vigorous man, and has an enterprising spirit which has enabled him to achieve his objectives.

Currently he is requesting the loan with the intent of investing in merchandise at wholesale (toys and items for babies and children), and this way he will have a greater variety of products available to sell, to satisfy the tastes and needs of his customers. 

Billy dreams of having his own shop where he can carry on his business and generate better income. This will allow him to help his family get ahead in life, providing them with better living conditions and for his son, an excellent education.

loans.use: To buy merchandise at wholesale (toys and party items for children and babies).

loans.name: Rosebell

texts.en:
Rosebell is a single mother with three children. She lost her husband in 2009. She also takes care of two dependents who lost their parents. All her children attend school.

She deals in coffee growing and trade. She applied for a loan of 800,000 UGX to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and add more manure in her coffee plantation for better yields. After  this project, she hopes to produce 1,000 tonnes of coffee each season. She will use the rest of the money to pay tuition for her children. Her major challenges are pests and  diseases which attack her coffee, and thieves who steal her coffee when it's still in the garden, hence reducing her seasonal productions.

Despite the above challenges, Rosebell is a very hard working and trustworthy woman working hard to provide a better education for her children.

loans.use: to buy organic manure

loans.name: Cheom

texts.en:
Cheom, aged 53, is a married woman and has eight children. She makes a living by selling breakfast to local people in her area of Ponhea Leue district, Kandal province. She sells pork porridge and Khmer noodles and earns a net profit of 20,000 KHR per day. She has been in this business for eight years and it serves as the family’s primary source of income.

Cheom wanted to create another business opportunity to generate additional income for household, but she has insufficient funds to make this possible. As a result, she has applied for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR to buy a fishing boat and other materials needed for fishing activities. This new business will be handled by her son. She thanks lenders for this constant support. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat and other materials needed for fishing activities

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 39 years old and married, from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She has three children, ages 16, 14, and 9 years old. Her husband is a fisherman.

Clarita engages in fishing. She catches fish and sells them to earn a living.  She started fishing more than 10 years ago. 

She is asking for a loan to buy a new fishing net to help augment the income of her household.

In the future, she hopes to expand her fishing business and increase her business's profitability, for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing net

loans.name: Wesley

texts.en:
Wesley lives in the Kericho area of Kenya, which has a climate that is excellent for agriculture. He has no children and has been doing this work for 4 years. His primary income sources are milk, tea, and crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Poultry keeping.' His biggest challenge is 'Market of the poultry product.' Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Wesley was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Because of easy repayment and grace period.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'It loans smallholder farmers in groups.'

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family', Wesley replied 'Family living standard will improve.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Wesley owns the following: 'poultry, motorcycle' but does not own 'cow, pig, pump, bicycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity' but does not have 'solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Agron

texts.en:
Agron’s livestock business came to an unwanted and painful end about two years ago when all six of his dairy cows along with the little baby calves passed away. He never found out whether it was someone who did this purposely to him, or if the cows ate something poisoned while they were grazing or were bitten by snakes.

“The thing is that it hurt me a lot; I had gotten used to the animals and to my daily routine of taking care of them and distributing the milk and selling other dairy produce to the local market. Financially, I was destroyed as well. I remember that early morning when I went to the stable as usually to feed them and take them out, when all of a sudden, I see all of them on the ground. At first, I wanted to believe that they were sleeping, yet right way I knew that something terrible had happen. I literally couldn’t stop my tears. It took me and my wife some time to get used to the idea and then we started slowly investing again on cows,” said Agron.

With this loan, Agron wants to buy some fodder for the animals.

loans.use: to buy fodder for the animals

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, a 32 year old married mother of four from Mwingi, owns a business selling cereals and other grains. Her children are aged 14, 13, 8 and 2 years respectively. She currently lacks the capital needed to purchase cereals in bulk to restock her store. With a loan from KADET LTD., Mary will be able to purchase cereals in bulk when she finds goods at low prices. 

She will then be able to have a fully stocked store which will attract more customers, generate sales, and create more profit due to a lower cost of goods sold. Additional income created will allow her to reinvest in her business, meet the needs of her family, and repay her loan in KADET. 

In the future, Mary would like to eradicate poverty in her family and give her children a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase cereals in bulk

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, a 47 year old single mother of two, is a business lady in Thika who has a business as a mixed crop farmer. She earns a monthly income of 6,000 KES, which she uses to support her family. This marks her fourth loan term with KADET after repaying her previous loans successfully. 

With the loan she has applied from KADET LTD., she will be able to purchase one day old chicks and chicken feed. Additional income created will allow her to pay school fees for her children and reinvest the rest in her business. In the future, Margaret would like to expand more on poultry farming and buy more livestock. 

She hopes to save money to educate her children and improve on the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase one day old chicks and chicken feeds

loans.name: Emilse Del Socorro

texts.es: Emilse es casada y madre de 2 hijos. A sus 55 años de edad, luego de ser ama de casa durante la mayor parte de su vida, se dedica a vender mercancía por catálogo, inicialmente lo hizo como un pasatiempo, para salir de la rutina del hogar y hoy en día ya tiene muy buena clientela y maneja 6 revistas, lo que le permite ofrecer mayor variedad a sus compradores, que están ubicados en diferentes barrios cercanos a su lugar de residencia, adicionalmente, en su casa tiene algunos productos disponibles para la venta. Ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer organizada, activa y emprendedora, por lo que se motiva a solicitar el crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido de las diferentes revistas (cremas corporales, cosméticos, accesorios, artículos para el hogar), con el fin de aprovechar los descuentos y las promociones para así aumentar el margen de utilidades en cada venta y mejorar los ingresos personales. Emilse sueña con seguir ampliando su clientela y adquirir una vitrina para exhibir los productos, pero es consciente que para lograrlo debe seguir trabajando con esmero y dedicación para que esta actividad le permita disfrutar de una estabilidad económica favorable y pueda seguir aportando para solventar los gastos básicos en su hogar.
texts.en:
Emilse is married and the mother of two children.  At the age of 55, after being a homemaker for the majority of her life, she makes a living selling merchandise via catalogue.  In the beginning she did it as a pastime, to change her household routine.  Now she has very good customers and works with six catalogues, which lets her offer  wider variety to her buyers, who live in different neighborhoods near her home.  In addition, she has some products on sale in her home.  

Emilse's known to be an organized, active, and enterprising woman.  This has motivated her to request the loan, which she'll invest in buying stock from the different catalogues (body lotion, cosmetics, accessories, and items for the home).  Her goal is to make the most of discounts and specials so she can increase her profit margin on each sale and improve her personal income.

Emilse dreams of continuing to expand her clientele and getting a display case to show her products.  She's aware, though, that to achieve this she has to continue to work with care and dedication so this job lets her enjoy a favorable economic stability and she can continue helping to pay for the basic household expenses.

loans.use: to buy stock from different catalogues

loans.name: Ived María

texts.es: Ived, con 42 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Durante su vida productiva se  ha dedicado a trabajar como comerciante independiente, actividad que conoce porque muchos de sus familiares se han dedicado a esta labor, ha manejado ferreterías y otro tipo de negocios. Actualmente, se encuentra desempleada, por lo que desea iniciar nuevamente su propio negocio de venta de mercancía, para lo que requiere el apoyo del crédito, con este comprará surtido al por mayor y vitrinas para exhibir los productos, así dará inicio a su proyecto productivo, con el que espera generar ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar. Ived sueña con hacer crecer su negocio, fortalecerlo para que sea reconocido en el sector y le genere buenos ingresos, al mismo tiempo que maneja su tiempo y puede estar pendiente de sus hijos y, en un futuro espera poder brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia y una excelente educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ived, 42, lives with her husband and her three children.  During her working life she has earned a living as an independent merchant, a job she knows because many of her relatives have worked in the field.  She has run hardware stores and other types of businesses.

Currently Ived is unemployed, so she wants to start her own merchandise business again, for which she needs a loan.  She's going to buy stock wholesale and display cases to display the products to start up her business project.  She hopes to earn income to help her husband with the financial responsibility of the household.

Ived dreams of making her business grow and strengthening it so it will be recognized in the sector and generate a good income for her while she manages her time and can watch over her children.  She hopes to give her family better living conditions and her children an excellent education in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock wholesale and a display case

loans.name: Duke

texts.en:
Duke is a very hard working man from Nakuru. He is 26 years old, not married yet, but he supports his parents and siblings.

He has owned a barber shop for the past six years and to enable him buy some more shaving machines, antiseptics, and small towels for use in the barber shop he has applied for his first loan of 20,000 KES from Kadet Ltd.

Duke's income per month right now is 10,000 KES, and he hopes to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to buy his own plot of land and build rental houses on it for extra income.

In the future, his dreams is to be self sufficient.

loans.use: To buy some shaving machines, antiseptics and small  towels to use in his barber shop

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, a father of four from Thika, has a business as a mixed crop farmer. He also runs a barber shop as his secondary business. He is married to Mary who helps him in farming. He earns a monthly income of 8,000 KES which he uses to support his family. 

This marks his first loan term with KADET. With the loan he has applied from KADET LTD, he will be able to purchase poultry feeds and purchase one pig for rearing. Additional income created will allow him improve the standard of living for his family. In the future, David would like expand his farming to become a large scale farmer. 

He hopes to save money to educate his children to the university level.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feeds and purchase one pig for rearing

loans.name: Meshack

texts.en:
Meshack is 40 years old and from Nakuru. He is married to Jacqueline, who is a housewife, and they have two children, ages 8 and 4 years.

He is in the transport sector, where he uses a bicycle to carry his customers.  He has been in this business for the past seven years. 

Meshack feels that he needs to be more efficient and effective in this business.  That is why he has applied for his third loan of KES 80,000 from Kadet Ltd to enable him buy a motorcycle, which is quicker than a bicycle.

Meshack's monthly income is KES 15,000.  He intends to use profits from his expanded business in repaying his loan to Kadet Ltd.  In the future, he hopes to buy a rickshaw.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for transporting his customers

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia is 39 years old and married. She lives with her husband and five children in the Batumi district, a seaside resort on the Black Sea. Her daughter works as a sales person at a clothes shop and gets 300 Gel per month. Mzia has rent out an apartment, which provides a monthly income of US$ 200. She runs a shop and works there during the day. 

Mzia has decided to add a café to the shop and to purchase furniture. The Start Up loan, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and MFO Credo, enables her to get a loan of US$ 2,400 for purchasing all the needed equipment for the café. The seaside resort is very popular, especially in the summer.

loans.use: to expand her shop and start a cafe

loans.name: Haron

texts.en:
Haron, 24, is from Nakuru; he is married to Judy, who is a business woman, and he has no children yet.

He is in the business of mobile money transfer i.e M Pesa, which he has has been doing for the last two years. To enable him to remain in business and be profitable, he has applied for his first loan of 20,000 KES from Kadet Ltd to be used to add float.

Right now, Haron's monthly income is 12,000 KES and he intends to use profits from his expanded business to expand his business further. He hopes to be a successful person in the future.

loans.use: to add on float for his mobile money transfer business.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 30-year-old business man. He is married to Margaret and together they are blessed with two children. Daniel has been in the business of repairing electronics for the past 7 years with a monthly income of KES 14,000, which he uses to support his family.  Daniel is applying for his second loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully.  

He will use part of the loan to purchase electronic repair tools and the remaining amount will be used for his children’s education. With the anticipated profit, he will improve the living standards of his family. 

His hopes and dreams are to construct a permanent residential house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase electronic repair tools and the remaining amount will be used for his children’s education.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie is 50 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell. Rosemarie has been in this business for twenty-two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, diapers and other groceries. In the future Rosemarie would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: María Yeni

texts.es: María tiene 40 años de edad, ha trabajado en diferentes negocios de producción de obleas y barquillos, pero hace algún tiempo decidió independizarse y con unos ahorros que tenía empezó su propia microempresa. Trabaja sola todos los días y en temporada de demanda contrata a una persona para que le colabore, así ha conseguido los recursos suficientes para aportar a la economía de su familia, conformada por su esposo y su hijo de 12 años. Actualmente solicita el crédito para utilizarlo en unas adecuaciones locativas que debe realizar, debe cambiar el piso y pintar las paredes del negocio, pues es un requerimiento que le hace la autoridad competente en sanidad. De esta manera podrá cumplir con todas las reglas para mantener su negocio en funcionamiento y dará una mejor imagen al establecimiento, además lo toma como un paso más hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño que es tener un negocio amplio, con mejor maquinaria, planchas y mejor presentación, lo que le permitirá aumentar su producción y satisfacer la gran demanda de productos, esto le dará la opción de incrementar sus ingresos y así continuar apoyando a su esposo con la carga económica de su familia y disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en: María is 40 years old. She has worked in a number of different businesses making wafers and waffles, but a while back she decided go out on her own and used her savings to start her own business. She works alone every day and during the the busy season hires someone to help her out. Her business has provided her the resources to support her family: her husband and her 12-year-old son. She is requesting this loan to carry out some needed renovations, including replacing the floor and painting the walls of her business as the health authorities have required. That way she will be in compliance with all the health codes and can keep her business running, as well as giving the place a facelift. She thinks of it as taking another step toward realizing her dream of having a successful business with updated equipment and that looks more inviting, which would help her increase her production and satisfy her customers' high demand. That way she would be able to increase her income and continue to support her husband with the family expenses and enjoy a better quality of life and well-being.

loans.use: to carry out some needed renovations, including replacing the floor and painting the walls of her business.

loans.name: Aida Rosa

texts.es: Aida, con 46 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos y vive con su compañero sentimental en unión libre. Hace aproximadamente 30 años se dedica a la confección a terceros, tiene su propio taller ubicado en la casa donde reside, trabaja de Lunes a Sábado y los ingresos que recibe son para aportar a la economía de su hogar. Esta actividad la aprendió de su madre quien lastimosamente ya falleció. La cliente es una mujer positiva, optimista trabajadora y dedicada a su familia y a su labor. Solicita el crédito para comprar dos máquinas planas industriales con las cuales podrá aumentar su producción, pues de esta manera agiliza su proceso  y puede entregar los pedidos de manera oportuna, abriendo la posibilidad de adquirir nuevos contratos y así incrementar sus ingresos. Aida desea seguir avanzando y fortalecer aún más su negocio y en un futuro poder montarlo en el centro de la ciudad, donde pueda incrementar su clientela y generar mayor rentabilidad para dar a su familia un mejor bienestar y condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Aida, 46 years old, has two children and lives with her life partner. She has been making clothes as a subcontractor for about 30 years. She has a workshop in her home and works from Monday to Saturday. She uses her earnings to contribute to the household. She learned her trade from her mother, who is sadly deceased. Aida is a positive, optimistic, hardworking woman who is devoted to her family and to her work. She is requesting this loan to buy two industrial sewing machines so she can increase her production. By making her process more efficient and completing orders more quickly, she will be able to take on new contracts and increase her income. Aida hopes to keep moving forward and expanding her business. In the future she'd like to open a business downtown, where she could increase her customer base and become more profitable, offering her family better living conditions and increased well-being.

loans.use: to buy two industrial sewing machines.

loans.name: Samson Mburu

texts.en:
Samson is 62 years old and married to Margaret. They are supporting two children, aged 8 and 6 years old.

He has a general shop in Ndunyu Njeru, which he has been running for three years. He has applied for his third loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy maize flour, rice and sugar, among other items. With the anticipated profit, he plans to buy more stock for his business and also boost his farming business.

In the near future, he hopes to expand his general shop and farming businesses.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, rice, and sugar, among other items.

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.en:
Saturnino is 49 years old. He is a farmer who lives in Alcala. He has four children, and only one is living with him. The others live separately. Aside from planting and harvesing rice to sell, Saturnino also provides motorcycle transport services as an additional source of income when he is not busy in farming. He has a strong determination to succeed. 

He is now asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy fertilizers and insecticides for his farming maintenance. This will help him improve his crop yield. Someday, Saturnino hopes to become a succesful farmer to keep earning good funds for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for his farm maintenance.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony was born in Machakos, a town southwest of Nairobi, Kenya. He moved to the Mukuru informal settlement of the capital city in early 2013. Upon arrival, he went to visit a friend who stayed in the informal settlement, which was when he first saw a Fresh Life toilet. Due to his desire to be an entrepreneur, he thought that he could invest in the sanitation business and make a living out of it. 

Anthony therefore seeks funding to purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets. He hopes to use these as his main source of income for the time he will be staying in Nairobi. Anthony hopes to lead a comfortable life with what he earns from his investment. He dreams of a future in which his venture will expand and enable him improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets

loans.name: Ayoub

texts.en:
Ayoub is a 34-year-old, married man and father of three children. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a distributor of foods, using his rickshaw to transport his goods. He works hard to meet the family's expenses. He would like to stock goods to increase his profit. 

For this reason, he has applied for a loan of 80,000 YER (Yemen rials) to buy foods in order to distribute them by using his rickshaw. He is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for him and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy foods in order to distribute them by using his rickshaw.

loans.name: Luis Ángel

texts.es: Luis es un hombre de 59 años de edad que ha vivido en el campo desde que nació, allí conoció las tareas agropecuarias, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. Hoy en día se dedica a comercializar ganado bovino de levante, compra los terneros, los cría  y alimenta y luego los vende, de esta manera genera los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento a su hogar y suplir las necesidades básicas de su familia que la conforman su esposa y tres hijos.
