Eudosia keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores. Eudosia believes that with PMPC's support, as one family, they will sustain and beat the competition.  

Eudosia has reached her fourth year being a member of Paglaum MPC. She has applied for a loan of 50,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) for the store. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store, and from there afford a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy groceries for the store.

loans.name: Ma. Violeta

texts.en:
Ma. Violeta is a 27-year-old woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with two young children aged five and one. Her husband is a fisherman.

She sells and catches fish to earn a living. She and her husband work hand in hand to meet the family's daily needs. Her business started four years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy materials to renovate the boat like ply wood, nails and epoxy or adhesive, to help augment the income of their household and improve their daily catch.

In the future, she hopes to expand her fishing business to improve their livelihood status and provide her children with the best.

loans.use: to buy materials to renovate her boat.

loans.name: Rokhy's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé le 16/07/2012.Il est composé de membres qui habitent dans le même quartier,elles ont comme activité principale le commerce.

Celle qui se trouve à l'extrême gauche de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 31 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 03 enfants dont 02 garçons.

Son activité est le commerce de marchandises telles que les chaussures,le parfum et de l'encens.

Elle compte acheter des chaussures pour 30000f,du parfum pour 25000f et de l'encens pour 20000f.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne et d'assurer les frais scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created on July 16, 2012. It is composed of members living in the same district. Their main work is in commerce. 

The one in the photo at the far left with her arm raised is the group's official. She is 31 years old, married, and the mother of three children, including two boys. 

Her main work involves commerce in merchandise such as shoes, perfumes, and incense. 

She intends to purchase shoes for 30,000 francs, some perfume for 25,000 francs, and incense for 20,000 francs. 

Her goal is to increase her savings and to ensure her children's schooling costs are covered.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, perfumes, and incense to sell

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es: Luz, a sus 51 años de edad es casada y madre de 3 hijos. Desde hace 6 años conoció sobre algunos productos nutricionales que han sido muy reconocidos por su alta calidad y los resultados que presentan las personas que los consumen; de allí surgió su idea de negocio, el cual inició hace aproximadamente un año, consiste en la venta de estos productos saludables, lo que le ha dado buenos resultados debido a que hoy en día muchas personas se preocupan por su imagen corporal, aumentando así sus ventas. La cliente es una mujer organizada, activa y emprendedora, se motiva a solicitar el crédito para invertir en la compra de surtido al por mayor (batidos, suplementos dietarios, multivitamínicos, entre otros) con los que podrá continuar con su actividad y aumentar sus ventas. Luz sueña con convertirse en una gran distribuidora de estos productos y trabajar arduamente para que muchas más personas se integren a la cultura de vida saludable que cada vez está tomando más fuerza en la ciudad, de esta forma tendrá la oportunidad de mejorar sus ingresos y disfrutar de mejores condiciones de vida en compañía de las personas que ama.
texts.en: Luz, who is 51, is a married woman with 3 children.  6 years ago, she found out about some nutritional products which have become well-known for their high quality and the results they achieve for those who use them.  This gave her the idea for her business which she set up about a year ago.      She sells these healthy products and has done well because many people today are worried about their body image. This has resulted in higher sales for her.  Luz is a highly organised, lively and enterprising woman and is applying for this loan to buy stock (milkshakes, dietary supplements, multivitamins, amongst other things) wholesale so that she can continue running her business and boost her sales.  Luz dreams of becoming a major distributor of these products and of working painstakingly so that many more people become interested in healthy living, as is increasingly the case in the city.  This will enable her to boost her income and enjoy better living conditions, along with her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy stock wholesale (milk shakes, dietary supplements, multivitamins, amongst other things)

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 52-year-old, married, mother of three children. She is a Palestinian refugee, living and working in a Palestinian camp. 

For eight years, she's worked with her husband, selling fresh milk and dairy products, such as yogurt and labneh (which is a creamy, tasty yogurt that's spread on bread).

Fatima’s clean work provides her with customers' support and loyalty, especially because she puts her products in sterile, healthy bottles. She is a hard-working woman, with good experience in her domain.

Fatima is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to buy a cow to increase milk production and dairy products. She hopes to stay in good health and to keep on expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a cow to increase milk production and dairy products.

loans.name: Oumou's Group

texts.fr:
Créer Le 07 Mai 2009, ce groupe est composé de femmes très actives dans l’agriculture de leur village, elles sont d’une solidarité sans faille. Elles se sont engagées dans le petit  commerce afin de réduire les obstacles à l’obtention des produits de consommation courante.

Madame Oumou (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, mère de 04 enfants dont 02 filles. C’est une femme très dynamique dans ses activités, elle est leader dans son banc villageois. Elle s’active dans la vente de savon, d’huile, de riz et divers autres produits alimentaires.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle va acheter du savon traditionnel pour 36 000 F CFA, 20 litres d’huile raffinée, 02 sacs de riz et divers assaisonnements.

Les bénéfices lui permettront d’apporter un soutien significatif à son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins en nourriture de la famille.
texts.en:
Created on May 7, 2009, this group is composed of women who are very active in agriculture in their village. Their solidarity is unwavering. They are dedicated to small-scale commerce to reduce barriers for obtaining typical consumer products. 

Ms. Oumou (seated at the far right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is a married mother of four children, including two girls. She is a very energetic woman in her work. She is the leader of her 'banc villageois' and is active in selling soap, oil, rice, and a variety of other grocery items. 

With her new loan, she is going to purchase some traditional soap for 36,000 francs CFA; 20 liters of refined oil; 2 sacks of rice; and various seasonings. 

The profits will allow her to support her husband significantly in meeting family needs in terms of food.

loans.use: to purchase traditional soap, refined oil, rice, and various seasonings to sell

loans.name: Hawa's Group

texts.fr:
Créer Le 07 Mai 2009, ce groupe est composé de femmes très actives dans l’agriculture de leur village, elles sont d’une solidarité sans faille. Elles se sont engagées dans le petit  commerce afin de réduire les obstacles à l’obtention des produits de consommation courante.

Madame Hawa (assise à droite avec la gauche levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est veuve et mère de 07 enfants dont 04 garçons, malgré son âge avancée, elle demeure une femme très utile dans le groupe car jouant le rôle de sage et de conseillère. Son activité s’inscrit dans la vente de savon, de sucre en poudre, divers autres produits alimentaires et du pétrole à usage domestique. Cette activité elle la pratique de plus de deux décennies.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter : 100 litres de pétrole à 96 000 F CFA, 02 sacs de sucre à 50 000 F CFA et du savon traditionnel pour 4 000 F CFA.
 
Les bénéfices lui permettront d’assurer les besoins familiales et de finaliser un bâtiment pour usage d’habitat.
texts.en:
Created on May 7, 2009, this group is composed of women who are very active in agriculture in their village. Their solidarity is unwavering. They are dedicated to small-scale commerce to reduce barriers for obtaining typical consumer products. 

Ms. Hawa (seated at the right with her left hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is a widow and a mother of seven children, including four boys. Despite her advanced age, she remains very helpful in the group, since she acts as the group's sage and advisor. Her business involves selling soap, powdered sugar, and various other supplies, and she sells kerosene for home use. She has had this business for over two decades. 

Her new loan will enable her to purchase:  100 liters of kerosene at 96,000 francs CFA; 2 sacks of sugar at 50,000 francs; and some traditional soap at 4,000 francs. 

The profits will enable her to ensure her family's needs are met and to finish a building in which to live.

loans.use: to purchase kerosene, sugar, and traditional soap to sell

loans.name: Asmao's Group

texts.fr:
Créer ce 18 septembre 2013 à l’occasion de son inauguration dans la place publique du village, ce banc villageois compte en son sein des femmes déterminées à entreprendre des activités génératrices de revenu et de renforcer leur capacité de financement. Elles vivent dans un même village depuis plusieurs décennies et entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles s’activent dans le petit commerce.
 
Madame Asmao, âgée de 35 ans (assise à l’extrême droite avec la main gauche levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants dont un garçon et cinq filles. Elle son activité est centrée dans la vente de beignet à base de farine de mil dans les marchés hebdomadaires et au village.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter deux sacs de mil pour transformation en farine de mil une dizaines de kilos de sucre et autres ingrédients.

Les bénéfices me permettent d’une part d’aider mon mari à prendre en charge les besoins de la famille et d’autre part à accroître mon chiffre d’affaire.
texts.en:
Created this September 18, 2013 on the occasion of its inauguration in the village's public square, this "banc villageois" counts on women within it who are determined to take on income generating businesses and to strengthen their capacity for financing. They have lived in the same village for several decades and sustain relationships of solidarity and helping each other. They have small shops.

Madam Asmao, 35 years old (sitting on the extreme right with her left hand raised), is the featured borrower of the group. She is married and mother to six children of whom one is a boy and five are girls. Her business is based on the sale of doughnuts made from mil [African cereal] flour in the weekly markets and in the village.

With her new loan, she plans on buying two bags of mil to transform it into mil flour, 10 kilograms of sugar, and other ingredients.

The profits allow her partly to help her husband to take care of the needs of the family and partly to grow her turnover.

loans.use: to buy two bags of mil to transform it into mil flour, 10 kilograms of sugar, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Masitula's Group

texts.en:
Masitula's Group is comprised of six hard-working women. Masitula is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kisekende, in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past three years, Masitula has been working hard to manage her restaurant, in which she sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Masitula has requested a loan of UGX 600,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more food to sell in her restaurant and will help Masitula to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her siblings. Masitula hopes that, in the future, she will be able to own a bigger restaurant. 

Masitula is a member of BRAC Uganda's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) Program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to stock more food to sell in her restaurant.

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Cerila is 61 years old and lives in Dampalan, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is married, with three children. 

Cerila has a pig-raising business and earns about PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Cerila has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, she hopes to succeed in her business.

loans.use: to pay for feed and vitamins for her pigs

location.town: Plaridel - Dampalan, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occident

loans.name: Om-Mahmoud Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om-Mahmoud Group and it consists of four women. They are all female and live in Aden, Yemen. This group works in different businesses in order to improve their living conditions. They took out a loan of YER 160,000. 

Sabah is the leader of group and she lives in Aden, Yemen. She is 49 years old. She has been selling different things as a business for three years. She is married and has two children. 

She started her clothing business by saving money and then she went ahead to operate her business well. She puts forth a lot of effort to increase her profit, so that she can apply it to her family`s needs. 

Sabah applied for a loan of YER 50,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) to buy goods for her business, such as clothes, ladies' fabrics, and incense. She hopes to expand her business and to enroll her children in private schools.

loans.use: to buy goods for her business, such as clothes, ladies' fabrics, and incense.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 56-year-old divorced woman who works as a tailor. Mariam has a sewing machine and works at her house. She is a hard worker with 20 years of experience. Mariam is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a car that will help her to buy necessary tailoring supplies that will improve her business. She will also be able to buy better quality products at better prices.

She hopes that in the future she will be financially capable of opening her own tailoring shop and expanding her work activities.

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Binta's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé le 05 Mai 2009 lors de l’inauguration du banc villageois a su se maintenir malgré des conditions difficiles de marché concernant la vente. Il regroupe en son sein des femmes très engagées dans la gestion de leur organisation. Elles vivent toutes dans le même et partagent un esprit d’équipe et de solidarité. Elles ont comme activité le petit commerce et font la riziculture pendant l’hivernage.

Madame Binta (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Malgré son âge avancé, elle reste une femme exemplaire et soucieuse du devenir de sa famille. Veuve de son état, elle prend en charge 04 de ses filles et 02 garçons et s’active dans la vente de divers produits alimentaires de la patte d’arachide aux condiments et autres bouillons culinaires. 

Avec son crédit, elle prévoit d’acheter des paquets de bouillons et divers autres condiments pour la revente au village.

 Avec les bénéfices,  elle compte assurer la prise en charge sanitaire de ses enfants et la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
This group was created on May 5, 2009 when the 'banc villageois' was inaugurated. It is composed of women who are very dedicated to running their organization. They all live in the same [village] and share a spirit of teamwork and solidarity. 

Ms. Binta (seated at the far right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. Despite her advanced age, she remains a fine example for the group and cares for her family's future. A widow, she supports four daughters and two sons, and she is active in selling a variety of grocery supplies, from peanut butter to condiments, and more. 

With her loan, she plans on purchasing packets of bouillon cubes and various other condiments to resell in her village. 

With the profits, she plans on ensuring that her children's healthcare and day-to-day expenses are covered.

loans.use: to purchase packets of bouillon cubes and various other condiments to resell in the village

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is 61 years old, married, and a resident of Siari, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. Her husband is a vendor, and the family is blessed with seven children. Starting with a capital of 10,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. 

Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoy the benefits given by the co-op. She became a member last November 2009, and has taken out three loans. 

Now she is applying for 50,000 PHP to purchase more inventories to sell in her "sari-sari" business. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart and will be fully satisfied if she sees her children have their own businesses or sell for her as well.

loans.use: to purchase more inventories to sell in her "sari-sari" business.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is 52 years old and is very responsible with his household obligations. He has always been known to provide the best for his family. He currently lives with his wife and two children. He is a farmer who plants rice, corn, and vegetables.

Jose wants to increase sales. Consequently, he has requested a loan that will enable him to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizer, among other items, so that he can continue to put bread on the table in his home.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, and fertilizer

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is from Goris town, where she lives with her husband and daughter. Gayane doesn't work as she has to take care of her husband, who is an invalid and has a disability pension. 

Gayane's daughter Nona is a student at Goris State University. She specializes in the pedagogical department and currently is in her first course of study.

It is very difficult for Gayane to cover the family's expenses and at the same time save money for Nona's education, so Gayane is asking for a loan. She has requested this loan to cover her daughter’s university tuition and give Nona an opportunity to complete her education.

loans.use: to pay university tuition for her daughter

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is widowed with four children. Felipa is 68 years old and lives in Western Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental.
Felipa sells dried fish to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. 

Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more kilos of fish to sell.
Felipa has been a member of PMPC for four years. 

In the future, Felipa hopes to have more savings for her family future.

loans.use: to pay for more kilos of fish to sell.

loans.name: Khadidiatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé le 17/07/2012.Il est composé de membres issus du même quartier,elles ont pour activité principale le commerce.

Celle qui se trouve au milieu de la photo,habillée en bleu et levant le bras est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 56 ans,elle est mariée et  a 07 enfants en charge.

Son activité consiste à transformer les céréales.Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de 05 ans.

Avec son prêt,elle va acheter 1000kg de mil  à 4000f le kilo,100kg de mais à 2000f le kg et 50kg haricots pour une valeur de 20000f et 50 kg d'arachide pour une valeur de 20000f.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne et constituer un fonds de commerce solide pour les futurs ravitaillements.
texts.en:
This group was created on July 17, 2012. It is composed of members from the same district. Their main work involves commerce. 

In the photo, the one in the middle dressed in blue with her arm raised is the group's official. She is 56 years old and married, and she has seven children to support. 

Her main work involves processing grains. She has been working at this business for over five years. 

With her loan, she is going to purchase 1,000 kg of millet at 4,000 francs per kilo; 100 kg of corn at 2,000 francs per kilo; 50 kg of beans worth 20,000 francs; and 50 kg of peanuts worth 20,000 francs.

Her goal is to increase her savings and to build up solid capital for resupplying herself in the future.

loans.use: to purchase millet, corn, peanuts, and beans

loans.name: Ghulam Qasim

texts.en:
Mr. Ghulam Qasim is a very competent and hardworking person who is serving best for neglected community. He is accomplishing his own dream about a school. He has aimed to serve underprivileged families with very low income set up. 

He opened a school in 2001 with 20 students, and two teachers were teaching in his school. He said that he has a dream to provide best education to his students. He is providing almost free education to youngster bright future. He is trying his best to fulfill his desire and facing many challenges. 

Ghulam Qasim said: "I have no other source of funding and school has no profits yet. School and household expenses became terrible to manage. In March 2009, I changed school building due to high rate of rent, but it was not a good decision because new land lord also created problems for us. So finally I shifted my school to my house."

Ghulam Qasim discussed that he heard about Kashf Foundation loan provision for school development through a school owner. He contacted Kashf School Sarmaya team through this way, and requested to Kashf Foundation for PKR 100,000 for computer lab, school renovation and classroom items. 

He said that he has planned to give computer skill from nursery to metric students, and a computer teacher will be hired. He discussed that computer education is very important for our children. He said: "I will continue my best services for deprived community." 

He has a mission to provide quality education to the maximum number of children.

loans.use: to pay for computer lab, school renovations and classroom items expenses.

loans.name: Lifamy

texts.en:
Lifamy is a 27-year-old woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with one young child. Her husband is a fisherman.

She engages in fishing. She sells fish, crab, and sea shells to earn for a living. Her business started five years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials, such as masks, foams and flashlights, to improve her daily catch to augment higher income.

In the future, she hopes to expand her fishing business, increase its profitability, and save for her child’s education.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as masks, foams, and flashlights.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 44 years old and lives in Culo, Molave ZDS. She is widowed and has two children. Evelyn has a mini carenderia (small restaurant) where she serves dishes such as fish tinola and pork guisado. She earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month doing this work. She has requested a loan to purchase more kilos of pork, fish, beef and other ingredients for her business. Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business and open another business some day.

loans.use: To purchase pork, fish, beef, and other ingredients

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 33-year-old woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol.  She is married with two children aged nine and one year old respectively. Her husband is a fisherman.

She  engages in fishing.  She sells fish, crab and sea shells as a source of livelihood. Her business started nine years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy plywood, epoxy  (adhesive) and paint to renovate a motorboat in order to improve her daily catch.

In the future, she hopes to expand her fishing  business and increase business profitability for her children’s education and to set aside to save to purchase a new motor boat.

loans.use: to buy plywood, epoxy  (adhesive) and paint to renovate a motorboat.

loans.name: Hina

texts.en:
Ms. Hina is a 23-year-old married lady; she is shown with a veil in the picture as she is obliged to maintain religious and social norms.  She has a passion for giving quality education to her community and receiving happiness from children. She opened her school in April, 2013 with 20 students and 2 teachers. She says, “My house is surrounded by many government and private schools. All these schools have different schemes of studies and teachers cannot meet the level of the students. Student’s learning disabilities are increased day by day. Our students received information in an inappropriate way and could not apply these lessons in real life.  I opened this school so I can give authentic, proper, and inclusive education to the students.” 

She says that now we are facing many challenges due to the commercialization of education. Education means enhancing students’ abilities through effective learning. Parents can not realize how their children are treated in school and how their children get into problems.” Hina is catering to students’ learning disabilities through focusing on primary education. She says, "I have the aim to concentrate on children's basic learning and its effective implementation in real life." 

She also says,  "I am a very old client of the Kashf foundation and feel happy to know about the new initiative of the Kashf foundation for schools."  She requests a loan of Rs. 100,000 for furniture, computers, and printed copies. She says “Kashf solved my big problem with the financial barrier." Hina plans to improve her school's enrollment and ensure quality education through inclusiveness.

loans.use: to buy furniture, computers,  and printed copies to use in her school.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Schools are the most important institutes for bringing change in underprivileged communities of any country. Here is a story of a woman by the name of Ms. Samina, who was deprived basic necessities in her childhood. She found many problems during her own career building, and found non-conducive environment.

Samina wants to serve her community through quality education. She explained her dream of community-oriented school for the deprived children. She says: “I feel pain for the children who are not going to school because of financial barriers.”  She opened her school in 2008 with the help of her husband.  

Initially, she was teaching in another building that did not satisfy her eagerness of quality education. In 2008, the school had only two desks, one black board, one box of chalks, one teacher, and 10 students enrolled. She said that she started investing the entire income of her house on the school and waiting for best results. 

Samina says: "It was hard time and we were facing many problems. Later on, income increased day by day because of our hardship and continued efforts." 

In 2010, she went for a new building to expand her school. In the new building, she enrolled 32 students, and later on the enrollment increased to 95 students. She said during this, the building owner died and his son insists us to pay rent too high. At this point, she shifted her school into her house because of landlord misbehavior. She says that she was very disturbed and her school went down day by day.

She heard about Kashf Foundation through their family friends, and met Kashf staff for school loan purpose. Kashf team briefed her about Kashf School Sarmaya and its procedures. She shared her mission and vision with the Kashf team members. She discussed that if she gets the loan, she can provide many other good opportunities to her learners. She shared that she will construct her school rooms and provide furniture to the students. 

She was so pleased to receive a loan of PKR 100,000. She said, children from low income background will get quality education and become responsible citizens.

loans.use: to construct her school rooms and provide furniture to her students.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 34 years old, married and lives at Lower Inuman, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. In order to earn a living, she takes in and raises pigs from their neighborhood. The piglet’s owners share in profit upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30, depending in their agreement.  With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well. 

Through Paglaum MPC, she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy additional feed. She really hopes and prays that her business would grow and benefit her family in addition to the income from her husband. 

Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feeds.

location.town: SINDANGAN-LOWER INUMAN, SINDANGAN, ZAMBOANGA DEL N

loans.name: Bineta's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est constitué de membres qui habitent le même quartier,elles ont comme activité le commerce et l'agriculture.

Celle qui se trouve à l'extrême droite de la photo et levant le bras est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 67 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 09 enfants dont 04 garçons.

Elle s'active dans la transformation de produit alimentaire,elle achéte  de l'arachide qu'elle transforme en pâte qu"elle revend dans le marché de son quartier.Elle pratique ce type d'activité depuis plusieurs années ce qui lui a permis de tisser une relation clientéle assez large.

Son objectif est de financer les études de ses enfants avec les bénéfices réalisés et aider son mari dans le budget familial.
texts.en:
This group is composed of members living in the same district. Their work involves commerce and farming. 

In the photo, the one at the far right with her arm raised is the group's official. She is 67 years old, married, and the mother of nine children, including four boys. 

She is active in processing food supplies. She purchases peanuts that she processes into peanut butter to sell at a market in her district. She has been in this type of business for several years, and this has allowed her to build up a fairly large customer base.

Her goal is to finance her children's studies by using the profits she makes and also to help her husband with the family budget.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts to make peanut butter to sell

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de vingt sept femmes qui habitent le même village et ont comme activités la couture, la coiffure et le commerce.

Madame Ndéye Khady la représentante du groupe est une femme mariée âgée de 28 ans, elle est mère d'une fille. Elle fait de la coiffure depuis 2004 à domicile et a une assez bonne expérience.Elle est debout à droite habillée en robe orange et a levé la main gauche.

Son prêt lui servira à acheter des mèches, des greffages et des produits cosmétiques; elle peut se faire une bonne clientèle car il n'y a pas assez de salons de coiffure dans la localité.

Avec ses bénéfices elle épargne dans le système et dans une banque de la place et a la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group is composed of 27 women who live in the same village. Their work involves sewing, hairstyling, and commerce. 

Ms. Ndéye Khady is the group's representative. She is a 28-years-old married woman and a mother with a daughter. Ms. Ndéye Khady has been styling hair  at her home since 2004 and has a fair amount of experience. In the photo, she is the one standing at the right and dressed in orange with her left hand raised. 

Her loan will be used to purchase some hair extensions, wigs, and cosmetics; she can establish a good customer base, since there are not enough hair salons in her town.

With the profits, she saves money in the system and at a local bank, and she supports her family.

loans.use: to purchase wigs, hair extensions, and cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a married woman and a mother of three children from Talibon, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari, or variety store, business selling various goods and commodities to the people in her place. She is also into hog raising business. These are the sources of her income.

Evangeline is asking for a loan for her store. She is requesting a loan to buy stocks to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soaps and toiletries.

Evangeline hopes of expanding her business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy stocks to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soaps and toiletries.

loans.name: Qristina

texts.en:
Qristina is a young farmer from the village of Aghitu of Syunik region. She lives with her pensioner mother and elder brother. Qristina works in the private sector as a seller in a local store. She is also involved in breeding a livestock of sheep and hens, as well as cultivation of beech, potato, cabbage, apple, pear and walnut. 

Qristina's brother assists her a lot during the farming activities; he helps her realize the agricultural products in the local market. As life gets expensive day by day, Qristina wants to enlarge the livestock to meet the family's needs more effectively. She needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase 20 sheep and some forage for the livestock. 

As this is Qristina’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. 

Qristina and her family will be very thankful to the lenders for their goodwill and support in collecting the needed amount of loan for maintaining their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sheep and some forage for the livestock.

loans.name: Setou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé le 17/07/2012.IL est composé de membres qui habitent le même quartier.Elles ont comme activité principale le commerce.

Celle qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 48 ans,elle est mariée mais n'a aucun enfant à charge.

Elle a comme activité la vente du savon,de la poudre détergente et de l'huile.Elle capitalise une expérience riche de 05 ans dans ce type de vente.

Elle compte acheter 06 cartons de 12 savons pour une valeur de 6000f,10 paquets de poudre détergente pour une valeur de 16000f,de l'huile pour une valeur de 22000f.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was created on July 17, 2013. It is composed of members living in the same district. Their main work involves commerce. 

In the photo, the one at the right with her arm raised is the group's official. She is 48 years old, married, but has no children to support. 

Her has a business selling soap, powdered detergents, and oil. She capitalizes on a rich experience of five years in this type of sales.

She intends to purchase 6 boxes of 12 soaps worth 6,000 francs CFA; 10 packets of powdered detergents worth 16,000 francs, and some oil worth 22,000 francs.

Her goal is to increase her saving.

loans.use: to purchase soap, powdered detergents, and oil to sell

loans.name: Benjie

texts.en:
Benjie is a fisherman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of five children. Benjie has been in the fishing business for more than six years now. This is the source of his income.

Benjie is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other fishing materials. With this, he will be able to improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market. 

Benjie hopes of improving his business and making it a success. Moreover, he wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel is 29 years old and lives in Getafe, Bohol with her husband and six young children. Her oldest is 9 years old while her youngest is 10 months. Her husband helps support the family by working in construction while she runs a sari-sari (or variety) store where she sells various items like cooking oil, canned food, shampoo, soap and dry goods. Her business started 10 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy a rice, various grocery items and soft drinks. In the future, she hopes to expand her store and increase its profitability so that she can pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice, various grocery items and soft drinks

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a 35-year-old woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with four children. The oldest is 14 while the youngest is 6. Her husband is a fisherman.

She engages in fishing. She sells fish as a source of income. Together with her husband, they work hand in hand to be able to meet the family's daily needs. Her business started three years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials, such as fishing net, lift weights and ropes, to augment income.

In the future, she hopes to expand her fishing business to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials, such as fishing net, lift weights, and ropes.

loans.name: Future Focus Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 42 year old Susan from Mutare. She is widowed and has two children, one attending school.  Susan runs a retail business selling clothes and electrical gadgets. The business has been in operation for four years. She says the main challenges faced are high import duty at border posts and high transport costs. Susan has requested a loan of $600 to purchase more clothes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve general family welfare. In the future, Susan plans expand her business to other parts of the country. Susan is a member of Future Focus group.

loans.use: to buy clothes and electrical gadgets from South Africa for resale

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is a 44-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in rice farming business for more than two years now. Her husband works as a tricycle driver.

Cristita is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her yield and profit.

Cristita hopes of expanding her farm and making it a sustainable source of her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her rice farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes from South Africa and Zambia, to supply to the working class in and around town.

loans.name: Mama

texts.en:
Mama lives in Bardnersville, one of the populated area in Montesorrado county. She is 36 years old and married with three children, ages between 15 and 6 years old, who are attending school and living at home. 

For the past 12 year now, she has been selling cosmetics, biscuits, and juices. She started this business with money that she received from her mother, and she learned this ways of selling from her friends. 

A challenge she faces is the transporting her goods to her table. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics, biscuits, and juices for her business. 

Her plans are to expand her business and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics, biscuits, and juices for her business.

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.en: Victoriana is a 57 year-old woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol.  She has a nine year-old son.  She  engages in  fishing. She sells fish, crabs and sea shells to earn a living. Her business started more than 10 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials like fish nets, and fertilizers for her farming business.  In the future, she hopes to expand her fishing business and increase business profitability for her child’s education.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fish nets, and fertilizers for her farming business

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Bonifacia is a 59 year-old woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married and has a three year-old son.  She engages in farming.  She works the land and grows rice. Her business started more than 10 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, rice seedlings and insecticides to improve her harvest and increase earnings.

In the future, Bonifacia would like  to expand her farming  business and increase business profitability for her child's well-being.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seedlings and insecticides

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is a 48 year-old married woman and a mother of six grown-up children.  Felicitas has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than 13 years now. She also runs a sari-sari store. These are the sources of their income.

Felicitas is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, and hooks, as well as stock for her store, like canned goods, biscuits and snack foods, soap and toiletries. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch and will give them more fish to sell in the market.
Felicitas hopes to make their fishing business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, and hooks as well as stock for her store, like canned goods, biscuits and snack foods, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a farmer from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is a married woman and mother of four children, ages eight, five, three and one. Farming has been the source of their income. Josefina is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides.

With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of their farm, thus augmenting their yield and income. 

Josefina hopes of expanding her business so that it will generate more revenue, necessary for the needs of the family such as food and payment of school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Zvidozvevanhu Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 56 year-old Mildred from Mutare. She is widowed and has three children, two attending school. She also cares for one other dependent. Mildred runs a retail business selling ladies suits, kid's wear and footwear. The business has been in operation for two years. She says the main challenges faced are high import duty at border posts and high transport costs. Mildred has requested a loan of $600 to purchase more clothes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve general family welfare. In the future, Mildred plans to have ownership of her own boutique shop in town. Mildred is a member of Zvidozvevanhu group.

loans.use: to buy clothes from South Africa for resale

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is a seaweed farmer from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She has been in the seaweed farming business for more than three years now. 

Esmeralda is asking for a loan to buy more seaweed seedlings, rope, and straw for farming. With this, she will be able to improve her seaweed farm, thus augment her harvest and yield. 

In the future, Esmeralda hopes of making her business a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more seaweed seedlings, rope, and straw for her seaweed farming business.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is a 44-year-old woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with nine children. The oldest is 22 while the youngest is 5 years old.

She engages in a buy-and-sell business. She buys, at the same time sells, sea cucumber. Aside from her buy-and-sell, she runs a sari-sari (variety) store.

She sells items like biscuits, noodles, cooking oil, shampoo and seasonings. Her sari-sari store business started one year ago. She is asking for a loan to buy various grocery stocks and additional capital for her buy-and-sell business.

In the future, she hopes to expand her both businesses and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy various grocery stocks for her buy-and-sell business.

loans.name: Dulce Amor

texts.en:
Dulce Amor is a 34-year-old married woman and mother of three children from Talibon, Bohol. She is engaged in retailing mineral water to the people in her place. This is the source of her income.

Dulce Amor is asking for a loan to buy more water gallons for her business. With this, she will be able to improve her business, thus augment her sales and income.

Dulce Amor hopes of making her business a success and saving money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more water gallons for her business.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is a widow from the town of Talibon, Bohol.  She engages in a pottery-making business. She makes pots made of clay and a mix of cement. Her business started 10 years ago. Aside from pottery making, she runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various items, like canned goods, condiments, eggs, sugar and soap. She is asking for a loan to buy more dry goods, like soft drinks, to sell.

In the future, she hopes to expand both her businesses and increase profitability for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more dry goods to resell like soft drink

loans.name: Felicitacion

texts.en:
Felicitacion is a 48-year-old married woman and a mother of nine children from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more 20 years now. This is the source of their food and income.

Felicitacion is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and others. With this, she and her husband will be able to improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

Felicitacion hopes of making their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and others.

loans.name: Brenice

texts.en:
Brenice lives in Gardnersvills. She is 26 years old, unmarried, and a high school graduate. She also has a 6-year-old child who attends school and lives at home. 

For the past three years, she has been selling copybooks, pens and many items in the market. She says that the main challenge she faces is transportation cost. 

She learned this way of selling from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more copybooks, pens and many items for her business. 

She wants to build a house and educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase more copybooks, pens and many items for her business,

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a 25-year-old hardworking man living in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a retail shop and also offers a service of mobile money transfers. With the proceeds, he has been able to buy land and also pay school fees for his children. Price fluctuation and inadequate capital are his major challenges. His dreams are to trade in wholesale. Godfrey intends to use the loan to buy powdered soap and tea bags to sell.

loans.use: to buy powdered soap and tea bags to sell.

loans.name: Mariama Souley's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été inauguré ce 18 Septembre 2013, et regroupe en son sein  des femmes qui s’activent dans les activités génératrices revenus plus particulièrement le petit commerce. Elles entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide  car habitant toutes dans le même village depuis plusieurs années. 

Madame Mariama  la quarantaine (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette de ce groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de  quatre  garçons et deux filles. Très engagée dans les activités du banc et du groupement du village. Son activité s’inscrit dans la vente sucre en détail par sachet de 100 F CFA en majorité de son chiffre d’affaire.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter au minimum 02 sacs de sucre de 50 kilos et divers condiments pour la revente au détail.

Avec  les bénéfices, elle projette d’accroître son chiffre d’affaire pour bénéficier de prêt plus importants dans le futur, en plus de mieux assister son mari dans les charges scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
The "banc villageois" was inaugurated this September 18, 2013, and groups together within it women in income generating businesses more specifically small shops. They sustain relationships of solidarity and helping each other as they have all lived in the same village for several years.

Madam Mariama, the fortieth (sitting to the extreme right with one hand raised), is the featured borrower of this group. She is married and mother to four boys and two girls. She is very engaged in the businesses of the "banc villageois" and the village group. Her business sells sugar retail by package for 100 FCFA for the majority of her turnover.

With her new loan, she plans to buy a minimum of two 50 kilogram bags of sugar and a variety of condiments to resell retail.

With the profits, she plans to grow her turnover to benefit from more significant loans in the future, in addition to better helping her husband with the responsibility of schooling their children.

loans.use: to buy a minimum of two 50 kilogram bags of sugar and a variety of condiments to resell retail.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 45 years old and live in Gardnersville; she is single and has six children between 3 and 26. For four years now, Nancy has been operating a shop, where she sells coal by the bag. Most interestingly she has many customers, since her business is in a very good location. She is requesting a loan to purchase more coal by the bag for her business; she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more coal by the bag for her business

loans.name: Yassa

texts.en: Yassa is 45 years old and lives in Gardnersville with her husband, a security guard, and their five children, aged 11 to 20. She has earned a living for the last three years by selling rice and soup. Her friends taught her how to do this, and the main challenge she faces today is increasing prices. She is happy when she increases her sales and makes a greater profit. Yassa is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, beans, pepper, fish, meat, and coal. She would like to increase the size of her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more rice, oil, beans, pepper, fish, meat, and coal.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 41 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She is married and has eight children whose ages are between 15 and 25. Only three live at home and attend school. For the past three years she has been running a shop which sells used clothes. She has a lot of customers and her daily sales are very high. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She plans to expand her business to a store business.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Rozi

texts.en:
Rozi is a 42-year-old married woman with ten children; she lives in Kasese, Uganda. For 23 years she has been selling clothes, and she also practices farming in order to raise income.

Good mother that she is, she desires to educate her children up to the university level and also set up sustainable income-generating activities to secure their future. Rozi intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Analyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a buy-and-sell root crops business. 

Analyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Marthaline

texts.en: Marthaline lives in Gardernesville, she is 29 years old and single, with a four year old child who lives at home and attends school.  For the past 7 years she has been operating a shop selling artificial hair in the local market, and learned this business from her mother.  She started her business with money given to her by her mother. She enjoys the flow of customers and profit she receives each day.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more artificial hair for her business.  In the future she wants to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more artificial hair for her business

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline is 22 years old, lives in Gardnersville, and completed the 12th grade before getting married to her husband who is a teacher.  For the past 4 years she has been selling meat and flour in the local market.  She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and learned this business from her friends.  She likes the way her business keeps her in one place, and that the business makes her proud.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more meat and flour for her business.  In the future she wants to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more meat and flour for her business.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en:
Eugenie earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place in Talibon, Bohol.

Eugenie is asking for a loan in order to buy more stock to sell suchas canned goods, candies, noodles, soda and beverages, soap, toiletries, etc. With the loan, she will be able to improve her stock and cater to more buyers thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Eugenie hopes to expand her store therefore generating more revenue.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, candies, noodles, soda and beverages, soap, toiletries, etc.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is a seaweed farmer from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is a married woman and a  mother of six children. Marichu has been in the seaweed farming business together with her husband for more than 10 years now. This is the source of their income.

Marichu is asking for a loan to buy seaweed seedlings. With this, she will be able to improve their seaweed farming and augment their income.

In the future, Marichu hopes to expand their business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings.

loans.name: Gamaliel De Jesus

texts.es: Gamaliel, tiene 28 años de edad, casado no tiene hijos aun, su esposa labora para una Universidad como secretaria, el tiene un puesto de venta de Zapatos Usados de lo cual sae han ajustado para los gastos basicos del hogar. solicita este credito para comprar materiales como bloques, Arena, Cemento, Piedrin, Hierro para construir una bodega para guardar la cosas del hogar. a ellos se les ha complicado recaudar el dinero y comprar de una sola vez los materiales ya que el ha tenido enfermo a su papa, pero gracias a KIVA y AFODENIC le dieron la oportunidad de contar con su apoyo.
texts.en:
Gamaliel is 28 years old, married, and still has no children.  His wife works for a university as a secretary.  He has a vending stall where he sells used shoes, which enables him to earn income for basic household expenses.  

Gamaliel is requesting this loan so that he can buy materials such as blocks, sand, cement, gravel, and iron in order to build a cellar for storing household items.  However, it has been difficult for him to allocate the money.  At one time he had the money to buy the materials, but then his father became ill.  Thanks to Kiva and AFODENIC, he now has this opportunity with their support.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a cellar.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 55 years old and married with five children.

Imelda works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like can goods, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Imelda has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from food vending and raising pigs.

Imelda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like can goods, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina is 35 years old, married and the mother of five children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines, and is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 from NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Cristina has been a farmer for the last five years, and also earns additional income by raising and fattening pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is 40 years old and married with three children.

Amy works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of household stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, chips, etc.

Amy has borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Amy aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, chips, etc.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a 45-year-old married man with seven children who lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. For the last six years, he has earned a living by selling a local drink he brews and by farming. His main challenges are the lack of a good machine to crush sugar cane, inadequate capital to buy raw materials to make his local brew and customers who do not pay their bills on time. His personal goals are educating his children up to the university level, building a home and expanding his business into new areas. Edward is requesting a loan to buy more local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy more local brew to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beans and sugar.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Jessica is a hardworking entrepreneur who earns a living by running a general store in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 18,000 from NWTF to buy items to sell such as soap, milk, canned goods and chips. Jessica has been in this business for three years, and supplements her income by buying and selling flowers and growing vegetables. She has sustained her business through her own hard work and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, including soap, milk, canned goods and chips.

loans.name: Celma

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Celma works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell bamboo business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell fruits. 

Celma is borrowing PHP 29,500 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks of bamboo to sell for her buy-and-sell bamboo business.

Celma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of bamboo to sell.

loans.name: Viflor

texts.en:
Viflor is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Viflor has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from a general store.

Viflor has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Aletha W.

texts.en:
Aletha lives in Logan Town and is 40-years-old. From 2006, she has been running a table in her community where she sells clothes and other items. She started this business with a little amount which she got right after her high school graduation program.  She is single and has four children between the ages of 17 and 24 which live at home and attend school. She hopes to maintain a house for her children through her business and continue to support them in school.

Aletha is requesting a loan to buy more clothes and others items for her business. She sells from Monday to Saturday spending ten hours each day.  She thanks Kiva partner BRAC Liberia for their support.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and others items for her business.

loans.name: Anzhela

texts.en:
Anzhela is from Qarahunj village, where she lives with her husband and two children. Anzhela and her husband work hard to sustain the family’s living. Their elder daughter is a student at Yerevan State Basic Medical Colllege. She studies hard and dreams of becoming a good nurse. 

It is very difficult for Anzhela to cover the family's basic costs and save money for her daughter's education, so she needs help. Anzhela asks for a loan to cover her daughter's tuition fees. She hopes for lenders' support as she greatly needs this loan.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es: Don Gregorio, tiene 39 años de edad, casado, tiene 6 hijos y vive en el departamento de Intibucá, siempre se a dedicado a realizar trabajos agrícolas. Lleva mas de 18 años de tener su propio cultivo de papas y hortalizas como repollo y otros. La producción la vende en el mercado local. Ha solicitado varios prestamos para mantener sus cultivos bien asistidos. Actualmente solicita otro de 30,000 Lempiras para comprar abonos, insecticidas, fungicidas y para limpieza con el objetivo de mejorar las cosechas y los ingresos para la familia. Su sueño a futuro es que además de dedicarse a la agricultura también a la ganadería.
texts.en:
Don Gregorio is 39 years old, married, and has six children.  He lives in the Department of Intibucá and has always engaged in farm work.  For more than 18 years, he has been growing his own potatoes and vegetables, such as cabbages and other produce.  Whatever he produces is sold at the local market.  He has requested several loans in order to keep his crops well-maintained.  

Gregorio is currently requesting another loan in the amount of 30,000 HNL so that he can buy compost, insecticides, and fungicides.  He will also pay to have his land cleared so that he can improve his harvest and earn more income for his family.  His goal for the future is to spend time raising livestock in addition to farming.

loans.use: to buy buy compost, insecticides, fungicides, and to pay for labor to clear his land.

loans.name: Yusra

texts.en: Yusra is a 29-year-old married woman who lives in Haja, Yemen. She is very hardworking. With much great effort and dedication, she has managed to save money. She is a housewife who has a child. She said that without sacrifice, there is no reward and if one wants to get ahead, you have to do what you can. She has a small house. The amount of money she has saved is not enough to renovate her house, so she has applied for a youth loan of 100,000 YER from Kiva partner AMB in order to buy construction supplies to renovate her house. With this loan, she will be able to live with her family a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to renovate her house.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rebecca works hard to support her family.

She has a repair/vulcanizing shop business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Rebecca is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her repair/vulcanizing shop business.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy-and-sell rice business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 15 years. Jocelyn earns more income from farming/selling vegetables.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Meriam works hard to support her family. She has a business selling rice grains in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from raising pigs. Meriam is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell for her business.

Meriam has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Diabou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois nouvellement  inauguré ce 18 septembre 2013 est composé de  femmes ayant un vœu ardent d’intégrer le programme de bancs villageois. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village depuis plusieurs années et entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide mutuel. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et la culture vivrière sous pluie.  

Madame Diabou (assise à la quatrième position de la droite vers la gauche avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 32 ans, est mariée et mère de deux filles. Elle tient une gargote au marché communale où elle vente le petit déjeuner et le déjeuner, c’est une activité qu’elle exerce depuis plus de trois ans. 

Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle sera en mesure d’acheter en quantité assez importante de riz soit deux sacs, du haricot vert, du lait, du sucre et divers autres produits entrant dans le processus de préparation des mets qu’elle sert aux clients. 

 Les bénéfices me permettront de participer à la prise en charge des besoins de la famille en nourriture, scolarité et sanitaire.
texts.en:
This "banc villageois", newly inaugurated this September 18, 2013, consists of women with a fervent wish to join the "banc villageois" program. They have all lived in the same village for several years and sustain relationships of solidarity and mutual support. Their main business is small shops and food crops in the rain.

Madam Diabou (sitting in the fourth position from right to left with one hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 32 years old, married and mother to two girls. She has a cheap restaurant at the communal market where she sells breakfast and lunch. It's a business which she has been in for more than three years.

With this new loan, she will be in a position to buy rice in fairly large quantities, namely two bags. Green beans, milk, sugar and a variety of other products are needed to prepare the dishes that she serves to customers.

The profits will allow her to participate in taking care of the needs of the family with respect to food, schooling and sanitation.

loans.use: to buy rice in fairly large quantities, namely two bags, as well as green beans, milk, sugar and a variety of other products.

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru: Фарида родилась и выросла в селе Куркат. Фариде 31 год. Замужем. Мать двоих прекрасных детей. Фарида очень любит своих детей,старается дать им хорошее воспитание. Муж Фариды  находиться в Российской Федерации. Он туда уехал на заработки. Сама Фарида добродушная,трудолюбивая женщина. По мнению знакомых она очень общительная, гостеприимная. Фарида любит животных,любит откармливать их. Свое любимое занятие она превратила в прибыльное дело. На сегодняшней день Фарида имеет несколько голов мелко рогатого скота, и в  дальнейшим хотела бы заняться более серьезным делом, например купли продажей крупно рогатых скотов. Конечно же ей в этом помогут её родные,так как ей одной не легко будет откармливать скот и перепродавать их. Чтобы внедрить свои планы в реальность она обратилась в "Арванд". На полученный кредит Фарида планирует купить скот и расширить свое поголовье скота.  Так как "Арванд" поддерживает женщин предпринимателей  Фарида надеется что организация посодействует Фариде своей финансовой поддержкой.
texts.en: Farida was born and raised in the Kurkat village.  She is 31 years old, married and a mother of two beautiful children.  Farida loves her children very much and tries to provide them with a good upbringing.  Her husband is in the Russian Federation.  He left there for work.  Farida is a kind and hardworking woman.  According to her friends' opinion, she is very outgoing and welcoming.  Farida loves animals and loves to feed them.  She transformed her favorite occupation into a profitable business.  Today Farida has several heads of small livestock and wants to get involved into a more serious business, for example, buying and selling cattle.  Of course, her relatives will help her with this because it would not be easy for her to fatten up livestock and resell it by herself.  She came to Arvand to make her plans come to fruition.  Farida plans to use this loan to buy livestock and increase her livestock headcount.  Because Arvand support women-entrepreneurs, Farida hopes that the organization will help her with financial support.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Mariliza

texts.en:
Mariliza is 31 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Mariliza is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Mariliza has been pig fattening for six years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Milyn

texts.en:
Milyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her buy-and-sell fish business.

Milyn has been in this business for six years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

Milyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

Ma. Elena has been in this business for 18 years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

Ma. Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs and farming vegetables. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell in her buy-and-sell vegetable business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Desiree

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Desiree works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pre-paid mobile loading.  Desiree is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like milk, sugar, flour, etc., for her food-vending business.

Desiree has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like milk, sugar, flour, etc., for her business

loans.name: Arame's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été inauguré ce 18 Septembre 2013, et regroupe en son sein  des femmes qui s’activent dans les activités génératrices revenus plus particulièrement le petit commerce. Elles entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide  car habitant toutes dans le même village depuis plusieurs années. 

Madame Arame, âgée de 51 ans (assise à droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de huit enfants dont  cinq garçons et trois filles. Elle est vendeuse de denrées de première nécessité à savoir le riz, le sucre, l’huile raffiné et de l’ognon. Qu’elle achète en quantité assez importante pour la revente  au détail dans son village.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter pour son commencer un sac de riz de 50 kilos 13 500 F CFA, un bidon d’huile raffiné de 20 litres à 16 000 F CFA qu’ elle revendra par verre d’un huitième de litre à 125 F CFA.

Les bénéfices me permettent en plus d’épargner et d’augmenter mon chiffre d’affaire d’accroître mon cheptel de moutons.
texts.en:
This "banc villageois" was inaugurated this September 18, 2013, and groups together within it women in income generating businesses more specifically small shops. They sustain relationships of solidarity and helping each other as they have all lived in the same village for several years.

Madam Arame, 51 years old (sitting to the right with one hand raised), is the featured borrower of the group. She is married and mother to eight children of whom five are boys and three are girls. She sells staples such as rice, sugar, refined oil and onion, which she buys in fairly large quantities to resell retail in her village.

With her new loan, she plans to buy one 50 kilogram bag of rice at 13,500 F CFA, and one 20 liter can of refined oil at 16,000 F CFA which she will resell by one eighth of a liter glass at 125 F CFA, for her business.

In addition to saving and increasing her turnover, the profits will allow her to grow her sheep population.

loans.use: to buy one 50 kilogram bag of rice at 13,500 F CFA, and one 20 liter can of refined oil at 16,000 F CFA, which she will resell by one eighth of a liter glass at 125 F CFA.

loans.name: Karlen

texts.en: Karlen is a young veterinarian from Armavir city of Armavir region. He lives with his parents and three sisters. Karlen, his father and his oldest sister are the ones who take care of the family's everyday needs. Karlen runs two local veterinary pharmacies, where different vet medications are sold. He currently needs to make some investments in his small business in order for it to function in a sustainable way. To reach that goal Karlen needs a loan of USD 3000 in order to purchase vet medications to resell in the pharmacies. He has already taken a loan from a local financial institution, but unfortunately wasn't able to repay it back. However, thanks to his hard work, Karlen was able to run his business in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, he has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Karlen will be thankful to all the lenders for helping him to sustain his small business

loans.use: to purchase vet medication to resell in pharmacies.

loans.name: Kanyanku Ugafode Group

texts.en:
Kanyanku Ugafode group is located on the outskirts of Rukungiri Town. The group members are basically involved in agriculture with a few that deal in small scale retail shops, goat trade, salon care and restaurants. 

Lydia is a married woman and a mother of three. Her main business is a beauty salon but she supplements with income from farming. She has only one child who goes to school since the other one is still young. She does all this with the support of her husband who encouraged her to start the salon business in 1999. Her main clients are basically women from around Rukungiri town. Lydia is determined to use the loan acquired from Kiva partner UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) to change her life and for her family by investing it in her salon business. She has secured a loan of ugx. 800,000 through the group in order to buy better driers and cosmetics to improve the quality of her services.

loans.use: to buy a drier and cosmetics for the salon.

loans.name: Toshtemur

texts.ru: Тоштемур житель Гиссарского района. Он является фермером и животноводом. Ему 43 года. Он женат и имеет четверых детей. Двое старших сыновей уехали на заработки в заграницу, остальные дети помогают отцу в его работе. Тоштемур вот уже 10 лет как вместе с женой занимаются выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур и разведением скота. Одновременно в несезон работы он занимается предоставлением услуги такси. Тоштемур очень трудолюбивый человек и всегда усердно трудится, чтобы обеспечивать семью. Кредит запрашивает для осеннего посева. На сумму кредита он собирается купить семена пшеницы и топлива, а также оплатить трактористу за вспашку земли. В будущем Тоштемур надеется приобрести еще земельный участок и расширить свою ферму.
texts.en: Toshtemur is a resident of the Gissar district.  He is a farmer and animal breeder.  He is 43 years old.  He is married and has four children.  His two older sons left to work abroad, and the rest of the children help the father with work.  Toshtemur and his wife have been involved in growing agricultural crops and breeding livestock for 10 years.  At the same time, he is involved in providing a taxi service during an off-season.  Toshtemur is a very hardworking person and always tries to work hard to provide for his family.  He is requesting this loan for the autumn sowing.
