He plans to buy wheat seeds and fuel with this loan and also to pay a tractor driver for plowing land.  In the future, Toshtemur hopes to buy another land plot and expand his farm.

loans.use: to buy wheat seeds and fuel, and to pay a tractor driver for plowing land

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.ru: Бахром 32-летний автомеханик проживает в городе Истаравшан, на севере страны. Он семьянин, имеет сына и двух дочерей. Бахром любит свою семью и каждый день работает усердно ради них. Он занимается ремонтом автомобилей в течение 3 лет. За день он чинит больше 10 легковых автомобилей. Это приносит ему хорошую прибыль. У него постоянно много клиентов, так как он выполняет свою работу в срок. Сейчас Бахром просит кредит для закупа запасных частей машин для продвижения деятельности.
texts.en: Bahrom is a 32 year-old auto mechanic, living in the city of Istaravshan, in the north of the country.  He is a family man and has a son and two daughters.  Bahrom loves his family and works hard every day for them.  He has been involved in repairing cars for 3 years.  He repairs over 10 passenger cars per day.  This yields him a good profit.  He regularly has many customers because he does his work in a timely manner.  Currently, Bahrom needs a loan to purchase spare auto parts for continuing his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare auto parts for continuing his auto repair business

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is an experienced farmer from the village Gandzaqar in Tavush region. She lives with her husband, and in engaged in breeding livestock of cows and hens, as well as in cultivation of corn, potato, grass, plums, apples and pears. Farming is the only source of the family’s income. They currently want to enlarge the livestock a little bit to be able to meet their increasing daily needs. A loan of USD 1300 will be a great support to this hard-working woman and will enable her to purchase two heifers and forage for the livestock. She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution, but unfortunately wasn't able to repay it back. However, thanks to her hard work, Aida was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Aida and her husband will be very thankful to all the lenders for helping them develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase two heifers and forage for the livestock.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her tailoring business.

Emily has been in this business for 18 years. She earns more income from a general store.

Emily has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: Eustaquia

texts.en:
Eustaquia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 52 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Eustaquia has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like noodles, meat, rice, spices, etc., for her food production business.

Eustaquia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like noodles, meat, rice, spices, etc., for her food production business

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is a 48-year-old woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with two young children. 

She engages in seaweed farming. She grows and sells seaweed as a source of income. Together with her husband, she helps sustain their family's daily needs. To help augment the income of their household, she started her business more than 10 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy seaweed seedlings, straw, and rope to improve her yield.

In the future, she hopes to expand her farming  business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings, straw, and rope

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feleciana is a 52-year-old woman who hails from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with 9 children. The youngest child is 19 years old. 

She  engages  in farming. She works the land and grows rice. Her business started more than 10 years ago. Her husband is also a farmer. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay laborers' fees, to improve her harvest.  

In the future, she hopes to expand her farming business and increase the business's profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and pay laborers' fees

loans.name: Davlat

texts.ru: Давлат жизнерадостный парень в возрасте 22 лет. Давлат пока ещё не женат, он живёт вместе со своими родителями и братом. Давлат после окончания школы в связи с финансовыми проблемами в семье не смог поступить в университет, чтобы получить высшее образование. Поэтому он вынужден заниматься малым бизнесом, чтобы зарабатывать на проживание. Его родители не работают по состоянию здоровья, старший брат помогает Давлату в ведении его бизнеса. Они вот уже как три года занимаются торговлей аксессуаров для женской одежды. Давлат привозит свои товары из столицы и продаёт на местном рынке. У него уже имеются постоянные клиенты, женщины очень любят вещи такого рода. От этого бизнеса Давлат имеет хороший постоянный доход. Сейчас он хочет расширить ассортимент своего товара, ему необходимо поехать в столицу и закупить ещё больше аксессуаров. Поэтому Давлат обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку аксессуаров для одежды. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Davlat is a happy young, 22 year-old man.  Davlat is not yet married and lives together with his parents and a brother.  After graduating from school, Davlat could not go to a university to obtain a higher education due to the family's financial problems.  This is why he has to be involved in a small business to earn a living.  His parents do not work because of their health, and the oldest brother helps Davlat to run the business.  They have been involved in selling accessories for women's clothing for three years.  Davlat brings the merchandise from the capital and sells it at a local market.  He already has regular customers since women love these types of things.  Davlat has a good, regular income from this business.  Currently, he wants to expand the selection of his merchandise and needs to travel to the capital to buy more accessories.  This is why Davlat came to Arvand and wants to obtain a loan to buy clothing accessories.  He thanks Arvand for the financial support in advance.

loans.use: to buy clothing accessories

loans.name: José Pedro

texts.es:
José de 35 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 3 hijos de 11, 9 y 8 años de edad, todos asistiendo a la escuela. Debido a las dificultades economicas, José dejo de estudar para trabajar y ayudar a la familia en lo economico.

Es agricultor, desde pequeño trabajo con su padre de quien aprendio todo lo que sabe y desde entonces se dedica a trabajar la tierra. En su casa presta los servicios de molienda, tiemne un molino de nixtamal y su esposa lo ayuda en el servicio al cliente. Trabaja la tierra desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 12 del mediodia, luege llega a su casa y atiende el molino.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar dos depósitos al molino, y a que solamente posee 2 y no es suficiente para atender a los clientes, que son muchos y el tiempo de espera se hace mayor. 

El sueño de Don José, es poder tener ganado lechero y dedicarse a otra actividad aparte de la agricultura. También desea construir un muro alrededor de su casa, para tener mayor seguridad. Uno de las metas que tiene con sus hijos, es poder ayudarles para que estudien, ya que reconoce que el estudio es muy importante y que ofrece muchas oportunidades de trabajo.
texts.en:
José, 35, is married and has three children, ages 11, 9, and 8, all of whom attend school.  He stopped going to school to work and help his family because of financial difficulties.

José's a farmer.  When he was little he worked with his father, from whom he learned everything he knows.  Since then he has earned a living farming.  José offers grinding services at home.  He has a nixtamal [hominy] mill and his wife helps him with the customers.  He farms from 6 in the morning until 12 noon, when he returns home and tends to the mill.

He'll use the loan to buy two containers for his mill because he only has two, which is not sufficient to take care of his customers.  He has a lot of customers so they have to wait longer.

José's dream is to be able to have dairy cows and to work another job besides farming.  He also wants to build a wall around his house to have better security.  One of his goals for his children is to be able to help them go to school; he knows that studying is very important because it offers a lot of job opportunities.

loans.use: to buy two containers for his mill

loans.name: Dominica

texts.en:
Dominica is a hog farmer within her locality. She is glad because her sacrifices have made her livelihood better. Dominica is 58 years of age, married and blessed with three grown children.

Dominica's husband is in charge of their half hectare of rice fields and 2,000 square meters of vegetable farmland. The couple both work hand in hand to earn a living. Dominica plans to buy livestock feed and medicine to nourish her pigs well. With regard to this matter, she is asking for a loan of PHP20,000. Dominica knows that this loan she requested would help her very much in improving the health of her pigs. In addition, it would improveme of her financial stability.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and medicine for her pigs

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza offers different kinds of vegetables and native cakes within her locality. She is happily married and blessed with four children. Only one child still attends school.

Flordeliza started her business in 1990. Finally, she was able to improve her financial stability through the help of her spouse. Aside from the vending of vegetables, Flordeliza also owns a half-hectare of rice field and vegetable farmland. According to her, she used to sell her products around her local community using her motorcycle transport. 

Flordeliza still hopes for continuous growth of her business, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000. This loan amount will be used to buy raw corn and different kinds of vegetables, such as string beans and eggplant. 

Flordeliza is looking forward to approval of her requested loan amount. In this way, she could let her one child finish her studies and she could secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy and sell raw corn and different kinds of vegetables, such as string beans and eggplant.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is a 49-year-old woman from the town of Trinidad, Bohol.

She engages in fishing. She catches and sells shrimp, fish and crabs to earn a living. Her business started five years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets to improve her daily catch. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her fishing business and increase business profitability to have a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
This is Vilma. She previously accessed an 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Vilma dreams that her business will continue to grow and flourish and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 39 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Francisca is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Francisca has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Kersthin Leonor

texts.es:
Kersthin Leonor vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja en una institución de estado en el área de archivo. Soltera, estudianteuniversitaria.
Con sus ingresos ayuda a sus padres económicamente y paga sus gastos universitarios.
Es una joven que trabaja de lunes a viernes y los días sábado   asiste a la universidad ya que está por concluir su carreara universitaria por esta razón Leonor  está solicitando un financiamiento para pagar aranceles y su titulo.
texts.en:
Kersthin Leonor lives in the city of Managua and works in a state institution in the archives section.  She is single and a university student.

With her earnings, she helps her parents economically and pays for her university expenses.  She is a young woman who works from Monday to Friday, and goes to college on Saturdays.  She is almost finished with her college degree, which is why she is applying for a loan to pay for tuition and her degree.

loans.use: to pay for university expenses.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel has been a farmer for more than ten years. He is married and residing at Sta. Cruz, Jimenez in Misamis Occidental. He grows and harvests rice for a living. 

At the age of 71, he is still strong and healthy working in his farm. He always finds ways to earn an income to save the profit for future emergencies. He joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to pay for the plowing and fertilization of the farm. He hopes to gain more harvest in return for his investments.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing and fertilization of his farm

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
This is Lydia, 53, resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Felix, a worker in a vulcanizing shop, and they have children. She and her husband are managing their household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lydia operates a market stall. She sells fruit products in the community market. She buys a quantity of fruits and sells it per kilo. She also sells plasticware like hangers, laundry baskets, basins, pails, clips, and others. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1,500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of fruits and vegetables to expand her product inventory. 

Lydia hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams of having a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more fruits needed in her business.

loans.name: Asel

texts.ru: Асель, 31 год, разведена, одна воспитывает 2 детей. После развода с супругом, Асель в поисках доходов для своей семьи начала небольшой бизнес по пошиву женской одежды с 2008 года, стартовав с суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS). Бизнес очень хороший, а самое главное Асель с удовольствием занимается своей работой-шитьем, которое приносит ей ежемесячный доход в сумме 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Асель обратилась в микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 50 000 сом(KGS) на закуп ткани для пошива женских брюк на осенний сезон. На доходы от кредита Асель хочет расширить свой бизнес, также накопить денежные средства на покупку дополнительных двух швейных машинок.
texts.en: Asel is 31 years old, divorced and raising two children by herself.  In search of income for her family, Asel started a small business in sewing women's clothing in 2008 after her divorce with an initial sum of 5,000 som (KGS).  The business is very good, but more importantly Asel enjoys her sewing work that yields her a monthly income of 8,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Asel requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy fabrics for sewing women's pants for the fall season.  Asel wants to use the earnings from this loan to expand her business and also to save money to buy two additional sewing machines.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for sewing women's pants for the fall season

loans.name: Jesil

texts.en:
Jesil is 40 years old and married with three children. With one child still in school, Jesil works very hard to provide for them.

Jesil runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

Jesil has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, eggs, detergent soap, shampoo, hair conditioner, bath soap, etc. 

In the future, Jesil would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a furniture-making business in the Philippines.

Juanita requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like wood, nails, paint, etc., for her business.

Juanita has been in this business for 20 years now.

Juanita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like wood, nails, paint, etc., for her business

loans.name: Morena

texts.en:
Morena is 43 years old and married, the mother of three children. She lives with her family in the town of Talibon, Bohol. 

Morena runs a sari-sari (or variety) store, selling various goods and items to the people in her locality.  Morena is asking for a loan to buy more stock for her store, like canned goods, noodles, biscuits and snack foods, soap, and toiletries.

With this, she will  be able to improve the variety of what she sells, thus allowing her to cater to more buyers and customers in her store.

In the future, Morena hopes to make her store business a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store, like canned goods, noodles, biscuits and snack foods, soap, and toiletries
